0.title: 'Scary' sound of Earth's magnetic field released by space agency
0.article_body: The European Space Agency (ESA) has released an audio which reveals how the Earth's magnetic field sounds like. "We are celebrating [Halloween] by listening to the scary sound of Earth’s magnetic field," ESA wrote. "Scientists at the Technical University of Denmark have taken magnetic signals measured by ESA's Swarm satellite mission and converted them into sound," it added.

1.title: We'll thrive again, not having any takeover discussions: Credit Suisse Chairman
1.article_body: Credit Suisse Chairman Axel Lehmann during an interview said, "We are going to thrive again, so we don’t have any takeover discussions." He added, "We want to stay independent." Notably, the company's share price has declined by more than half this year and it is also starting initial headcount reductions of 2,700 positions in the fourth quarter.

2.title: Axis Bank stock falls by over 2% after 1.3% stake sold via block deals
2.article_body: Shares of Axis Bank declined by over 2% on Tuesday after 4.1 crore shares or 1.3% equity worth ₹3,654 crore changed hands at an average of ₹894/piece. A US-based private investment company Bain Capital was reportedly looking to sell its 1.24% stake in the lender via block deals. At 10:10 am, Axis Bank's stock was trading 2.24% lower on NSE.

3.title: Village head, wife and mother shot dead while asleep in UP's Budaun
3.article_body: A 58-year-old village head, his 54-year-old wife and his 80-year-old mother were shot dead by unidentified assailants at their residence in Satra village in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun on Monday, police said. The victims were asleep at the time of the incident, police added. "During interrogation, it was found that there was enmity between family members," SSP Budaun OP Singh said.

4.title: 24-year-old Indian businessman shot dead by policeman in Uganda: Reports
4.article_body: A 24-year-old Indian businessman identified as Kuntaj Patel was shot dead by a policeman in Uganda, according to local reports. Patel's employee reportedly said that he and his boss were attending a client when the policeman entered their shop, aimed the gun at Patel and shot him in the chest. The accused has reportedly been charged with murder.

5.title: No objectification of woman, her body parts: Kangana on Madhubala's 'Aaiye...'
5.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that Madhubala's 'Aaiye Meharban' has "no objectification of woman and her body parts". "Sensuality and seduction [have] nothing to do with vulgarity and raunchy item numbers...this song has everything," she added. She wrote this as she shared a video clip of the song on her Instagram Stories.

6.title: Rahul is under a lot of pressure, he has gone into a shell: Uthappa
6.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Robin Uthappa said KL Rahul is under a "lot of pressure" having scored 22 runs so far in the three matches played till now by Team India in the T20 World Cup 2022. "It seems as if he has gone into a shell...Rahul's mind is clouded," added Uthappa. "I feel they should continue backing Rahul," he stated.

7.title: Depressed woman kills her children, attempts suicide in Navi Mumbai
7.article_body: A 32-year-old woman allegedly killed her two children and attempted suicide on Sunday evening in Navi Mumbai's Ghansoli village. Before taking the step, she had informed her husband that she was feeling depressed and experiencing extreme mood swings. Her husband used to sell ice-cream on a hand cart and had a loan to pay back.

8.title: Price of commercial 19-kg LPG cylinder cut by ₹115.50
8.article_body: The price of commercial liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) cylinders was cut by ₹115.50 on Tuesday. A 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,744 in Delhi. However, the price of the 14.2 kg domestic LPG cylinder has been kept unchanged. A 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,846 in Kolkata, ₹1,696 in Mumbai and ₹1,893 in Chennai.

9.title: Brazilian truckers block roads in protest of Bolsonaro’s election defeat
9.article_body: Truckers in Brazil protested the defeat of outgoing President Jair Bolsonaro on Monday by blocking roads in 20 states. Video footage showed some truckers at roadblocks calling for a military coup to prevent Lula da Silva from becoming the President. Lula, who'll become the President for the third time, won 50.9% of the votes compared with 49.1% for Bolsonaro.

10.title: West Bengal girl kills self as video of her stealing chocolates goes viral
10.article_body: A third-year undergraduate student died by suicide in West Bengal after a video of her stealing chocolates from a store in a shopping mall went viral. Her father said that she paid the price of the chocolates and also apologised to the store authorities. However, people at the store made a video of the whole incident and posted it online.

11.title: Halt 'useless' joint military drills with S Korea: North Korea to US
11.article_body: North Korea has demanded that US and South Korea stop large-scale military exercises in the region, calling them a "provocation". "If...US doesn't want any serious developments not suited to its security interests, it should stop the useless and ineffective war exercises at once. If not, it'll have to...take the blame for all...consequences," North Korea said. The drills began on Monday.

12.title: Fire breaks out at building that houses ex-cricketer Zaheer Khan's restaurant in Pune
12.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a building in Maharashtra's Pune on Tuesday morning. The top floor of the Marvel Vista building located at the city's Lulla Nagar Chowk caught fire. The building houses a restaurant owned by former India cricketer Zaheer Khan on the ground floor. No casualties or injuries have been reported so far.

13.title: Janhvi insisted we shoot in freezer with -8 to -12°C temperature: Boney on Mili
13.article_body: Film producer Boney Kapoor said that his daughter and actress Janhvi Kapoor is an enthusiastic actor. While speaking about the film 'Mili', he said, "She [Janhvi] insisted on shooting in an actual freezer where the temperature was...minus 8 to minus 12 degrees Celsius. In the second half of the film...it is only through her expressions that everything is conveyed."

14.title: Hyderabad Police mandates Anti-Drug Committees in all colleges
14.article_body: In a bid to spread awareness against the possession, consumption and sale of narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances, Hyderabad Police has mandated the setting up of an Anti-Drug Committee (ADC) in all city colleges and similar institutions. Commissioner of Police CV Anand said that police have now adopted a strategic move to insulate increasingly vulnerable youngsters in colleges.

15.title: Kyiv mayor urges EU leaders to maintain political, economic aid to Ukraine
15.article_body: During an interview with DW, mayor of Kyiv, Vitali Klitschko, urged European Union leaders to maintain political and economic aid to Ukraine. "Please stay with Ukraine...we are fighting and defending not just our homes and our country. We are defending every one of you in Europe", Klitschko said. He warned that Russian President Vladimir Putin won't stop at invading Ukraine.

16.title: Omar claims Ladakh authorities tried to stop him from visiting Kargil
16.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah has claimed that authorities in Ladakh tried to dissuade him from visiting Kargil and told him "not to come here". "There (Eastern Ladakh) China has come...you couldn't stop them...We are only going from Srinagar to Kargil via Drass," he said. He also alleged that he wasn't allowed to use a public address system in Drass.

17.title: Himachal Pradesh BJP expels 5 of its rebel leaders for 6 years
17.article_body: Himachal Pradesh BJP expelled five of its rebel leaders, including BJP state vice-president Kripal Parmar, from primary membership for six years. The others include former Kinnaur MLA, Tejwant Negi, former Anni MLA, Kishori Lal, former Indora MLA, Manohar Dhiman and former Nalagarh MLA, KL Thakur. They were indulging in anti-party activities, BJP state president Suresh Kashyap said.

18.title: Incredibly disappointed by gross invasion of privacy: ICC on leaked video of Kohli's hotel room
18.article_body: Reacting to the leaked video of Virat Kohli's hotel room in Perth, ICC said, "We're incredibly disappointed by the gross invasion of privacy suffered by a member of...Indian travelling party at Crown Perth." It added, "We continue to work with event hotels and security providers to ensure...this remains an isolated incident and player privacy is fully respected at all times."

19.title: Morbi bridge renovated by administration, no role of Guj govt: Ex-Dy CM
19.article_body: Following the Morbi bridge collapse incident, ex-Gujarat Deputy CM Nitin Patel said renovation and opening of the bridge were done by Morbi administration and the Gujarat government didn't have any role in it, direct or indirect. "Oreva is an old company for repairing watches...only Morbi municipality knows on which qualification it handed over the work of bridge renovation," Patel added.

20.title: Saudi Prince Alwaleed, Jack Dorsey among top investors in Twitter after Musk takeover
20.article_body:
As Elon Musk took over Twitter, regulatory filings revealed a list of top investors in the company. 
Saudi Arabia's Kingdom Holding Company, along with the private office of Prince Alwaleed bin Talal moved almost 35 million Twitter shares worth about $1.9 billion to become the "second-largest" investor in the new parent company. Jack Dorsey moved over 18 million shares.

21.title: Speeding car rams into Warkari procession in Maharashtra; 7 killed
21.article_body: Seven people were killed and several others injured after a speeding car rammed into a procession of Warkaris (pilgrims) in Maharashtra's Solapur on Monday, police said. The accident apparently occurred after car's 75-year-old driver lost control, according to police. State CM Eknath Shinde expressed grief over the incident and announced a ₹5 lakh ex-gratia for each of the deceased's families.

22.title: Aviation turbine fuel price hiked by 4.3% to ₹1.2 lakh/kl in Delhi
22.article_body: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF) was increased by 4.3% to ₹1.2 lakh/kilolitre from ₹1.1 lakh/kilolitre in Delhi on Tuesday. On October 1, ATF price was slashed by ₹5,521.17/kilolitre to ₹1.15 lakh/kilolitre. The price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was also reduced by ₹115 in Delhi with effect from Tuesday. A 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹1,744 in Delhi.

23.title: Taylor becomes 1st artist to claim top 10 slots of Billboard Hot 100 chart
23.article_body: Taylor Swift has become the first artist in history to claim Billboard Hot 100 chart's top 10 slots for a week with her new album 'Midnights'. Taylor has surpassed Drake, who had held the previous record with nine of the top 10 songs for a week in September 2021. "I'm in shambles," Taylor tweeted in reaction to the news.

24.title: What can I say: Ayushmann as friend reminds Tahira of wrong anniversary date
24.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana reacted after his wife Tahira Kashyap forgot their wedding anniversary date and posted a picture to wish him one day before the anniversary. Tahira said that she was reminded by a friend that she got the anniversary date wrong. "What can I say now? Happy anniversary in advance," Ayushmann wrote.

25.title: Actress Sonali Chakraborty passes away aged 59 in Kolkata
25.article_body: Bengali actress Sonali Chakraborty passed away at a private hospital in Kolkata aged 59 on Monday following a prolonged illness. Chakraborty was suffering from liver complications and was undergoing treatment at the hospital for months. She is survived by her actor-husband Shankar Chakraborty and their daughter.

26.title: 29-yr-old Delhi man frustrated over breakup shoots ex-girlfriend to death
26.article_body: A 29-year-old man killed his former girlfriend as he was allegedly frustrated over their breakup in Delhi, reports said. The accused was hiding in different hotels to escape arrest. Police said that there was no CCTV footage available for the incident and the arrest was made based on technical surveillance. Gunshot wounds were found on the woman's body.

27.title: Zomato restores woman's review on B'luru eatery over food poisoning, CEO thanks her
27.article_body: Zomato has reinstated the negative review made by a woman who claimed she and her colleague suffered severe food poisoning after eating at a Bengaluru restaurant. The review was removed on grounds of mentioning health code violations, Zomato earlier said. "We have removed this policy with immediate effect...Thank you for...influencing positive change," Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal told the woman.

28.title: Social media sites should proactively flag fake news: CEC Rajiv Kumar
28.article_body: The election management bodies expect social media sites to use their "algorithm power" to proactively flag fake news, Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar said. Kumar said that social media platforms proclaim to have content policies but added that they do also have the "algorithm power" and a proactive approach to countering fake news would facilitate "credible electoral outcomes".

29.title: Trump's real estate firm cheated tax authorities for 15 years: Prosecutor
29.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's real estate company cheated tax authorities for 15 years, prosecutor Susan Hoffinger said during a criminal tax fraud trial. Hoffinger added that the company paid certain executives, including former CFO Allen Weisselberg, in perks like rent and cars without disclosing it to tax authorities. If convicted, the Trump Organisation could face $1.6 million in fines.

30.title: iPhone output could fall by 30% at China plant amid COVID-19 curbs: Report
30.article_body: Apple iPhones' production could fall by nearly 30% at one of the world's biggest iPhone plants in China due to tightening of COVID-19 curbs in the country, Reuters quoted a source as saying. Several videos, circulated on social media, showed workers escaping from the Zhengzhou plant. Meanwhile, Foxconn is working to increase production at Shenzhen factory to meet the shortfall.

31.title: Twitter should repair the damage done to Trump: Mexican Prez
31.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador on Monday urged the new owner of Twitter, Elon Musk, to "repair the damage done by the cancellation of [former US] President [Donald] Trump's account". Obrador also urged Musk to free the social media platform from what he described as "conservative control". Trump was banned from Twitter after the 2021 US Capitol riots.

32.title: Hyderabad to get multipurpose sports complex in Banjara Hills
32.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has taken up the construction of a multipurpose indoor sports complex in Banjara Hills at an estimated cost of ₹6 crore. The one lakh square feet complex will have a cricket box, kabaddi court, badminton and tennis courts. It will also have gyms and a place for yoga along with carrom and chess games.

33.title: 2 die, 4 admitted to hospital after consuming illicit liquor in Pune
33.article_body: At least two members of a family, aged 35 and 40, died after allegedly consuming illicit liquor at Malegaon in Pune's Baramati on Sunday, police said. Notably, four more people from the same family who had also consumed the same liquor were admitted to a hospital. "We have booked three people in this case," police added.

34.title: ₹69.95 crore-heroin hidden in trolley bag seized at Delhi airport
34.article_body: The Air Customs at IGI Airport in Delhi has seized heroin worth ₹69.95 crore which was hidden in the false bottom and the top of a trolley bag, the Customs department said on Monday. A Belizean national who was carrying the trolley bag was arrested under the NDPS Act. The accused had arrived in Delhi from Johannesburg via Doha.

35.title: Get all hanging bridges in K'taka evaluated: Cong leader after Morbi mishap
35.article_body: After more than 130 people lost their lives in the Morbi bridge collapse, Karnataka Congress spokesperson Nivedith Alva has urged the Karnataka administration to get steel hanging bridges evaluated urgently. "I would urge the state administration to...ensure that basic maintenance is being carried out. This is required...especially in coastal areas that see very heavy rain," he wrote on Twitter.

36.title: B'luru's Namma Metro launches QR code-based ticketing system on WhatsApp
36.article_body: Bengaluru's Namma Metro in partnership with WhatsApp launched a chatbot-based QR ticketing service enabling users to ride the metro without using tokens or smart cards. The chatbot is integrated with Unified Payments Interface (UPI) powered payments on WhatsApp. To use the service, commuters need to send 'Hi' to BMRCL's official WhatsApp chatbot number 9181055 56677.

37.title: Man being extorted & threatened by 2 women, kills self in Pune
37.article_body: A 34-year-old man allegedly died by suicide at his house in Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad, police said. According to a suicide note, which was found in the deceased's pocket, two women "extorted money and gold jewellery from the victim and threatened to share photographs of their physical relationship with his wife", a senior inspector said. The incident occurred on Saturday, police added.

38.title: 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz receives world number one trophy, shares pics
38.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz received his world number one trophy in Paris on Monday evening. Sharing pictures on Instagram, Alcaraz wrote, "A special day! Today I received the world number one trophy in Paris! I should find somewhere to put it, no?" Alcaraz became the youngest men's world number one in tennis history in September this year.

39.title: What others see as 'layoff', I only see as time off: BYJU's CEO on rehiring fired staff
39.article_body: BYJU’s CEO Byju Raveendran sent an email to his employees after the recent layoffs at the company. On rehiring the laid-off employees, Byju wrote, "What others see as 'layoff', I only see as time off. Bringing you back...will now be...number one priority for me." He added that HR has been instructed to make new roles available to affected employees.

40.title: Think about your team instead of yourself: Gambhir on Babar Azam
40.article_body: Discussing Babar Azam's captaincy during Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Netherlands, Gautam Gambhir said, "[He] should've sent Fakhar Zaman up the...order." "This is called selfishness...It's easy for Babar and Muhammad Rizwan to open the innings...and create...records," added Gambhir. "If you want to be a leader, you've to think about your team [instead of yourself]," he stated.

41.title: 16-yr-old Mumbai girl looking for hide-&-seek playmates hit by lift, dies
41.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was killed after she stuck her head into the square opening of the lift door while looking for her playmates during a game of hide-and-seek in Mumbai's Mankhurd. Reports said that the lift descended and hit the girl on her head. The lift had reportedly been made operational five days ago.

42.title: We tried to hurry Bumrah back and look what happened: Chief selector Chetan Sharma
42.article_body: While announcing India squads for New Zealand and Bangladesh tours, BCCI chief selector Chetan Sharma said that it is important to look into players' workload management. "We tried to hurry Jasprit Bumrah back into Team India squad and look what happened. We are without him in T20 World Cup," he added. "NCA team is looking after him well," Sharma said.

43.title: We stand with India: US as Morbi bridge collapse claims over 130 lives
43.article_body: After a suspension bridge collapse in Gujarat's Morbi claimed over 130 lives, US President Joe Biden expressed his condolences and tweeted, "In this difficult hour, we will continue to stand with and support the Indian people." "We stand with the people of India who are mourning the victims of the devastating bridge collapse in Gujarat," US Vice-President Kamala Harris tweeted.

44.title: Still fighting perception that I'm entitled & untalented: Janhvi
44.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she's still fighting some people's perception that she's "privileged, entitled and untalented". "I am a hard-working girl who has something to offer. I am fighting to prove that to myself and other people," she added. Janhvi further added that she's learnt from her late mother Sridevi about how to survive in the film industry.

45.title: 53-year-old man stabbed to death while resisting robbery bid in Delhi
45.article_body: A 53-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death on Sunday by two unidentified persons while resisting a robbery bid near the Narela Railway Station in Delhi, police said on Monday. The incident occurred when the deceased, a resident of Haryana's Sonipat, was going to the station to board a train. The accused tried to take away his bag, police added.

46.title: Strikes on Ukraine power grid in response to Crimea attack: Putin
46.article_body: Russian strikes on Ukrainian power grid and a decision to freeze participation in a Black Sea grain export programme were responses to a drone attack on Moscow's fleet in Crimea on Saturday, Russian President Vladimir Putin said. Ukrainian drones had used the same marine passages that grain ships transited under the UN-brokered deal, Putin added. Ukraine has denied the allegations.

47.title: Schools, colleges shut in 3 districts in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday amid heavy rainfall alert
47.article_body: The schools and colleges in Tamil Nadu's Nagapattinam, Tiruvarur and Mayiladuthurai districts will remain closed on Tuesday in the wake of a heavy rainfall alert by India Meteorological Department (IMD). The northeast monsoon season arrived on October 29 in southern India, following which several areas of Tamil Nadu have been witnessing heavy rainfall and thunderstorms.

48.title: Actors Manjima Mohan, Gautham Karthik confirm relationship; share pics
48.article_body: Actors Manjima Mohan and Gautham Karthik have confirmed their relationship and shared pictures on Instagram. "Three years ago when I was completely lost you came into my life like a guardian angel," Manjima wrote. "I've a peace in my heart now that I've never felt before, and that's all because of what you have nourished in my life," Gautham wrote.

49.title: Musk dissolves Twitter's entire board to become sole director, says 'This is temporary'
49.article_body: A securities filing has revealed that Elon Musk dissolved Twitter's board of directors to become the sole director of the company. According to the filing, Bret Taylor, Parag Agrawal, Omid Kordestani, David Rosenblatt, Martha Lane Fox, Patrick Pichette, Egon Durban, Fei-Fei Li and Mimi Alemayehou are no longer directors of Twitter. Musk also tweeted that this move "is just temporary".

50.title: We used to give away tickets, people sold them for ₹10 to buy booze: Rishab
50.article_body: Actor Rishab Shetty recalled that he and actor Rakshit Shetty used to give away tickets for their films to people outside theatres. "But those people would sell the tickets for ₹10 to buy booze. That was also a time we faced. But now, our work is being appreciated by people and everyone is supporting," the actor-director added.

51.title: Mumbai driver records drunken confession of employer's affairs, blackmails him
51.article_body: The Mumbai Police are on lookout for a driver who secretly recorded drunken 'confession' of his employer about his alleged illicit relationship with daughters of his live-in partner. The driver blackmailed both employer and his live-in-partner to send the recording to the daughters' husbands and extorted ₹10.70 lakh from them. The live-in partner filed a complaint after the blackmail continued.

52.title: 'Steel Man of India' Jamshed J Irani passes away aged 86
52.article_body: Dr Jamshed J Irani, widely known as the 'Steel Man of India', passed away at the age of 86 in Jamshedpur late Monday night, Tata Steel confirmed. Irani joined Tata Steel in 1968 and retired after spending 43 years at the company in 2011. The Padma Bhushan awardee served as the Managing Director of Tata Steel from 1992 to 2001.

53.title: Elon Musk to serve as Twitter CEO
53.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk will serve as the CEO of Twitter, according to a regulatory filing on Monday. This will be in addition to Musk running Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink and The Boring Company. In a separate filing, it was revealed that Musk has dissolved Twitter's board, becoming its sole director after acquiring the company on Friday.

54.title: Instagram fixes bug that suspended multiple accounts, cut follower count
54.article_body: Instagram on Monday said it has fixed a bug that prevented people across different parts of the world from accessing their accounts and "caused a temporary change for some in number of followers". The outage reportedly lasted for about eight hours. Many users had complained about receiving messages that said their accounts were suspended.

55.title: Gautam Adani becomes world's 3rd richest person with $132 billion wealth: Forbes
55.article_body: Gautam Adani on Monday reclaimed his position as the world's third-richest person with $131.9 billion wealth. The 60-year-old industrialist overtook Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos on Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List after adding $314 million to his net worth. Elon Musk is currently the world's richest person with $223.8 billion fortune, followed by Bernard Arnault with a net worth of $156.5 billion.

56.title: Passenger gets India-SA score update on tissue paper from pilot onboard flight, shares pic
56.article_body: A Team India fan shared a picture of a handwritten India-South Africa T20 World Cup 2022 match score update given to him by a pilot on a tissue paper onboard an IndiGo flight. "India lost today...but IndiGo ⁦won my heart. Pilot sent...note mid-air when requested for score update," he tweeted. "We're glad to see this," IndiGo responded to his tweet.

57.title: US Prez got angry in June phone call with Zelenskyy, said 'show gratitude': Report
57.article_body: US President Joe Biden raised his voice at Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a phone call in June, NBC News reported. Biden had reportedly just finished telling Zelenskyy about America's new $1 billion military aid when the latter started listing additional help needed by Ukraine. Biden became angry and said Zelenskyy "could show a little more gratitude", the report added.

58.title: Hope you are watching everything, Sai Baba: Prithvi Shaw after Team India snub
58.article_body: In an apparent reaction to him not being selected in Team India squads for New Zealand and Bangladesh tours, Prithvi Shaw shared a picture of Sai Baba on Instagram Stories. He wrote, "Hope you are watching everything, Sai Baba." The 22-year-old batter last played for India in July 2021.

59.title: 19-year-old Dewald Brevis smashes fastest 150 in T20 cricket history
59.article_body: Titans batting all-rounder Dewald Brevis on Monday smashed the fastest 150 in the history of T20 cricket. The 19-year-old South African crossed the 150-run mark off 52 deliveries against Knights in a CSA T20 Challenge match to break the record previously held by Chris Gayle (53 deliveries). Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, scored 162(57) in the match.

60.title: Will do films my heart says yes to, not for any other reason: Rajkummar
60.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao in an interview said, "I'm just going to do films I believe in, that my heart says yes to and not for any other reason." The actor will next be seen in 'Monica O My Darling', a neo-noir crime comedy directed by Vasan Bala. Rajkummar is also set to star in 'Guns & Gulaabs' and 'Bheed'.

61.title: Some couldn't come, we couldn't invite some: Ali as he shares pics from reception
61.article_body: Ali Fazal, taking to Instagram, shared a video featuring pictures from his wedding reception which took place in the first week of October. In the pictures, Ali and his actress-wife Richa Chadha were seen posing with Hrithik Roshan, Tabu and others. "I want to thank everyone...Some couldn't come, we were unable to invite some...but our love is...with you," Ali wrote.

62.title: Tamil Nadu logs 152 COVID-19 cases in 24 hrs; active cases decline
62.article_body: Tamil Nadu reported 152 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, taking the state's total case tally to 35,92,043, the state health department informed on Monday. No deaths due to the infection were recorded. Tamil Nadu's active case count fell from 1,732 on Sunday to 1,602 on Monday, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

63.title: Norway raises military alert level in response to Ukraine war
63.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Store on Monday announced that his country's military would be put on a higher level of alertness from Tuesday in response to the war in Ukraine. "There are no indications that Russia is expanding its warfare to other countries, but the increased tensions make us more exposed to threats, intelligence operations and influence campaigns," Store added.

64.title: We didn't get the start with bat: Ireland captain Balbirnie on loss vs Aus
64.article_body: Ireland captain Andy Balbirnie said his side didn't get the start with the bat in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Australia. "But to show the fight at the end was nice. Looking at the scoreboard we thought it wasn't against us," he added. Chasing 180, Ireland were bowled out for 137 in 18.1 overs.

65.title: It wasn't the easiest wicket: Finch after scoring 63(44)
65.article_body: After scoring 63(44) and winning the 'Player of the Match' award, Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that it wasn't the easiest wicket to bat at the Gabba. "It was a lot slower than what we expected. They (Ireland) changed their pace really well and bowled a lot of cutters...it was hard to get a rhythm," Finch said.

66.title: Who knows if someone had stayed with Tucker: Balbirnie after losing to Aus
66.article_body: After losing to Australia by 42 runs, Ireland skipper Andy Balbirnie said the match was hardly fought. "Looking at the scoreboard we thought it wasn't against us, again the wickets column was a problem and who knows if someone had stayed with [Lorcan] Tucker," Balbirnie said. Notably, Tucker scored 71*(48) against Australia at Gabba on Monday.

67.title: Not here to be liked, having a great time with my team: Verstappen
67.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen said abuse from Lewis Hamilton fans does not bother him. "I am not here to be liked, and it's not going to ruin my day. I am having a great time with my team," said Verstappen. He added that the abuse could be due to "frustration" as Hamilton "is not doing so well" this year.

68.title: Need to convert more chances: Ind hockey skipper Harmanpreet
68.article_body: After being beaten for the first time in the ongoing FIH Hockey Pro League, Indian hockey skipper Harmanpreet Singh said that the team needs to "convert more chances" into goals. "We were trying for different variations and combinations. But sometimes, they do not work out," Harmanpreet said. Notably, India lost to Spain by 2-3 in Bhubaneswar on Sunday.

69.title: BAI announces ₹5 lakh cash reward each for Sankar Muthusamy, Satwik-Chirag
69.article_body: Badminton Association of India (BAI) announced ₹5 lakh cash reward each for Sankar Muthusamy and doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty for their recent performances. Sankar became only the second Indian male singles player to win a silver at World Junior Championships. Rankireddy-Shetty became the first Indian doubles pair to win a Super 750 title at French Open.

70.title: Kerala policewoman wins 2 gold medals at World Arm Wrestling Competition
70.article_body: Kerala Police Assistant Sub-inspector Mini Raju won two gold medals at the World Arm Wrestling Competition held in Turkey. "This is the first time we (India) won so many medals. Also after 1979, I am the first one to win double gold for the country at the event," said Raju. She picked up the sport during a competition in 2018.

71.title: Partha Chatterjee's judicial custody extended in WB SSC scam case
71.article_body: A special CBI court extended the judicial custody of suspended TMC leader Partha Chatterjee by 14 days in the West Bengal School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam case. Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee were arrested by ED in July. Cash worth around ₹50 crore, jewellery and gold bars were also seized from flats allegedly owned by Mukherjee.

72.title: We now have to nurture Tejashwi Yadav: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
72.article_body: Bihar CM and JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar said that they now have to nurture Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav. Notably, JD(U) recently broke its ties with the NDA-led BJP and joined hands with the RJD-led coalition, which also includes Congress, to form the government in Bihar. Rejoining the NDA in 2017 was a "mistake", CM Nitish said.

73.title: Something may happen on sedition law in Winter Session: Centre
73.article_body: Attorney General R Venkataramani told the Supreme Court that the Centre is reviewing Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code which criminalises sedition and said that something may happen in the Parliament's Winter Session. The AG asked for additional time for the Centre so that appropriate steps can be taken. The matter was fixed for further hearing in January 2023.

74.title: 10 dogs & 2 puppies shot dead in Andhra medical college, case filed
74.article_body: A case has been filed against the management of GSL Medical College and others in Andhra Pradesh's Rajahmundry after 10 dogs and two puppies were shot dead on campus. The 'shooters' have reportedly been killing dogs for years as animals create "problems" for students. An alleged video of the dogs tied to a vehicle and being dragged has gone viral.

75.title: Rajasthan BJP legislator's son arrested in dowry harassment case
75.article_body: Rajasthan Police have arrested Prakash Garg, son of BJP legislator Jogeshwar Garg, in a dowry harassment case. Prakash surrendered before the police after the Rajasthan HC vacated the stay on his arrest. Prakash's wife Mamta, who is the daughter of Rashtriya Loktantrik Party (RLD) legislator Pukhraj Garg, had filed a complaint against him and his parents in 2020.

76.title: BJP leader, lawyer call for 'Truth Commission' over 1984 riots
76.article_body: BJP leader RP Singh and lawyer HS Phoolka have written to Home Minister Amit Shah and PM Narendra Modi respectively calling for a 'Truth Commission' into the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. Phoolka alleged "enough evidence" shows riots "probably" took place "under instructions" from former PM Indira Gandhi. Singh sought the declassification of documents pertaining to Operation Blue Star and the riots.

77.title: Amendment to counter 'perverse trends' will be proposed: Turkey Prez
77.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Monday said his party will propose constitutional amendments to protect families from "perverse trends". "While...unity between woman & man...is [being] scorned; perversion...& crooked relationships are being encouraged," he said. Erdogan and his party members have referred to members of the LGBT community as "deviants" or "perverts" in recent years.

78.title: ICC allows prosecutor to resume probe into Afghanistan atrocities
78.article_body: The International Criminal Court (ICC) on Monday allowed its prosecutor Karim Khan to resume his probe into atrocities committed in Afghanistan. The court observed that Kabul "is not presently carrying out genuine investigations" into the alleged crimes. The now-deposed Afghan government had asked the ICC to pause the investigation in 2020 so that Kabul could carry out its own inquiries.

79.title: India in talks to expand bilateral trade through rupee accounts: Report
79.article_body: The Indian government is reportedly in talks with African nations like Zimbabwe, Djibouti, Ethiopia, Malawi and Sudan to expand bilateral trade through bespoke rupee accounts. Along with this, it is also reportedly trying to internationalise indigenous payment methods. The discussions are aimed at replacing SWIFT by creating a separate payment ecosystem and overcoming dollar-dominated trades.

80.title: RBI imposes ₹5 lakh fine on LIC Housing Finance for violating norms
80.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) imposed a fine of ₹5 lakh on LIC Housing Finance for not complying with provisions of the National Housing Bank. A ₹1.76 crore fine was also imposed on Vakrangee Ltd by the central bank. RBI clarified the penalties were not intended to pronounce the validity of transactions or agreements entered into with its customers.

81.title: In pressure situations, make use of technology: Hogg on no-ball call
81.article_body: Citing instances from India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match, former Australia cricketer Brad Hogg said that in pressure situations, technology should be used to make the right decisions. "We have TV replays that can give us the right result," he stated. Hogg cited examples of waist-high no-ball signalled against Pakistan, Axar Patel's run out and Ravichandran Ashwin dropping Shan Masood's catch.

82.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states for next 2 days, list released
82.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs for next two days. It is very likely over parts of Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Mizoram, Manipur, Tripura and West Bengal on October 25. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Nagaland on October 26.

83.title: What is Virat Kohli's record while chasing in T20 World Cup history?
83.article_body: Virat Kohli has scored 541 runs at a strike rate of 135.92 in T20 World Cup matches in which India have batted second. Kohli has scored these runs in 10 innings, out of which he has remained not out in eight. Kohli's highest score in these matches is 82*(53), registered against Pakistan on Sunday, and his batting average is 270.50.

84.title: How do the latest T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 points tables read?
84.article_body: New Zealand are on top of the T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 points table with a superior net run-rate than Sri Lanka and England. Australia are last on the points table. Bangladesh lead Group 2, having superior net run-rate than India. Meanwhile, South Africa and Zimbabwe have one point each after their match ended producing no result.

85.title: If India think they can win WC without Virat, it's not possible: Inzamam-ul-Haq
85.article_body: Calling Virat Kohli "zabardast", ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said, "If India think that they can win the World Cup without Virat, it's not possible." He added, "The Indian team is dangerous only on one condition, when Virat plays brilliantly. I'm telling this clearly." Kohli remained unbeaten at 82 to help India chase down Pakistan's 160-run target in their T20 WC match.

86.title: Congress is simply busy walking on the path of illusion: K'taka minister
86.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar criticised Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra, claiming that the party is simply busy walking on the path of illusion. "With Bharat Jodo Yatra coming to an end in Karnataka, the big question remains whether it really served any purpose other than Congress’ classic divide and rule politics?” said Sudhakar.

87.title: Pakistan convinces Saudi Arabia to revive former's $12 bn refinery: Report
87.article_body: Pakistan has persuaded Saudi Arabia to revive the former's $12 billion refinery and petrochemical complex, an investment that was shelved during Pakistan PM Imran Khan's regime, according to reports. Saudi Arabia had planned the investment in 2019. They backed out after Khan allegedly tried to form a bloc of Islamic countries, outside Saudi-dominated Organisation of Islamic Cooperation's ambit.

88.title: Twitter user points out a typo in Shashi Tharoor's tweet on Virat Kohli, he replies
88.article_body: A Twitter user by the handle @perthinent pointed out a typo in Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's tweet on Virat Kohli. The user stated she thought Tharoor misspelled "authentic" as "authetic" in the tweet, adding, "But 'authetic' is a real word and makes sense in this context." Tharoor replied, "Thanks for coming to the rescue...@perthinent, but it was, alas, a typo!"

89.title: PM Modi congratulates Rishi Sunak, calls him 'living bridge' of UK Indians
89.article_body: PM Narendra Modi congratulated Rishi Sunak, who will become the first UK Prime Minister of Indian descent. PM Modi tweeted, "As you become UK PM...I look forward to working closely together on global issues, and implementing Roadmap 2030." He added, "Special Diwali wishes to the 'living bridge' of UK Indians, as we transform our historic ties into a modern partnership."

90.title: For now, we have a set XI: Mitchell Marsh on Smith's chances of playing vs SL
90.article_body: Australia all-rounder Mitchell Marsh has said that it's unlikely that Steve Smith, who missed their T20 World Cup match against New Zealand, will play in their second match against Sri Lanka on Tuesday. "We're early on in the tournament, things can change, but for now we have a set XI," he stated. Australia lost against New Zealand by 89 runs.

91.title: TN students attack toll plaza staff in Andhra; video surfaces
91.article_body: A video has surfaced showing students of a law college from Tamil Nadu allegedly attacking toll plaza workers in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati over payment-related issues. The students were returning after an exam when they were stopped at the toll plaza. The clash continued for a while and some vehicles were damaged even after police reached the spot.

92.title: Bug in iOS 15.7.1 beta update causing Face ID malfunction: Report
92.article_body: Several iPhone users reportedly faced issues with their Face ID after installing the iOS 15.7.1 beta update. Reports said a bug in the beta update resulted in users facing problems resetting their Face ID on their devices. They were greeted with a "Face ID not available" error every time they tried to use facial recognition on their iPhones.

93.title: I would be happy if Kumaraswamy becomes K'taka CM: BJP MLC
93.article_body: BJP MLC M Chidananda Gowda said that he would be happy if JDS leader HD Kumaraswamy becomes Karnataka's CM. "Our community (Kunchitiga) should also be included in the list of Other Backward Class (OBC)," the BJP MLC said.  He further added that whosoever becomes the CM should include the Kunchitiga community in the OBC list.

94.title: Why were Zimbabwe awarded 5 penalty runs against SA in their T20 WC match?
94.article_body: Zimbabwe were awarded five penalty runs against South Africa in ninth over in their T20 World Cup match on Monday. This came after wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock threw his glove before collecting a throw, and the ball went on to hit the stray glove. South Africa were penalised as ball hit an object intentionally placed on the field of play.

95.title: India's best-kept secret: Odisha CM on pics of Chilika Lake
95.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik recently took to Twitter to share some pictures of Chilika Lake. "Chilika Lake has been integral to Odisha's culture & literature. It is a nature lovers' paradise and host to a fascinating carnival of avian guests," he tweeted. Calling the lake "India's best-kept secret", he said, "This winter let's spend time with the symphony of nature."

96.title: John Shaw loved India, was compassionate, friendly: Infosys ex-CFO Pai
96.article_body: Former Infosys Chief Financial Officer Mohandas Pai on Monday said Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw "loved India" and was a "very compassionate and friendly person". "John was a...business leader who understood business strategy...and worked hard with Kiran to build Biocon," Pai said. John Shaw passed away on Monday.

97.title: K'taka government approves 11 projects to generate over 41,000 jobs in state
97.article_body: The Karnataka government has approved 11 development projects which are expected to bring in investment worth over ₹1.74 lakh crore. The new projects are expected to benefit the youth in the state by generating over 41,000 jobs. According to reports, out of 11 projects, eight are going to be related to clean energy.

98.title: Shinde as Maha CM is BJP's 'temporary arrangement': Uddhav-led Sena
98.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, in its mouthpiece 'Saamana', claimed that 22 out of the 40 MLAs in Eknath Shinde-led Sena will soon join the BJP. In its weekly column, Uddhav-led Sena claimed that Eknath Shinde as Maharashtra CM was a "temporary arrangement" made by the BJP. Everyone has understood that his Chief Ministerial uniform will be taken, Sena said.

99.title: Kannur University VC called me to facilitate an attack: Kerala Guv
99.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Monday said he called Kannur University's Vice Chancellor "criminal". "What other word should I use for a person who invites me to Kannur to facilitate an attack on me?...After Kannur incident, [he] wrote back to Raj Bhavan that [he is] not a security expert, so he can't give a report," Khan added.

100.title: Mohammad Hafeez criticises Babar Azam, says 'His captaincy is like a sacred cow'
100.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez criticised Pakistan captain Babar Azam after their defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022. "Babar Azam's captaincy is like a sacred cow that cannot be criticised," he said, adding, "It's the third consecutive big game in which we're seeing flaws in his captaincy...but we keep hearing that by time he gets to 32, he'll learn."

101.title: PM Modi meets Army Major after 21 years in Kargil, pic goes viral
101.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Major Amit on Monday while on a visit to Kargil on the occasion of Diwali. PM Modi had earlier met Major Amit in 2001 when the latter was a student at a Sainik school in Gujarat's Balachadi. PM Modi and the Major posed together with a photo which comprised their picture from 2001.

102.title: Govt should solve hunger issues and not discredit bodies: Kharge
102.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said that the central government should solve hunger problems in the country instead of discrediting the organisation. Asking the BJP to focus on the hunger crisis, Kharge added, "In the last 8 years, we have seen that there has been slow progress on this front." India ranked 107 among 121 countries on the Global Hunger Index.

103.title: China chip imports fell 12.4% in Sept year-on-year: Govt data
103.article_body: According to official customs data, China's chip imports fell 12.4% in September to 47.6 billion chip units, compared to 54.3 billion units in September 2021. The data was supposed to be released earlier this month but was delayed due to the Communist Party Congress. In the first nine months of 2022, total output was down 10.8%.

104.title: US teenager pleads guilty to mass shooting at high school
104.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, Ethan Crumbley, on Monday pleaded guilty to murder and terrorism charges in a mass shooting that killed four of his classmates at a high school outside the US city of Detroit. Six other people were injured in the attack that occurred last November. Crumbley pleaded guilty to a total of 24 charges in Oakland County Circuit Court.

105.title: Mbappe to get €630 million by end of 2025 contract with PSG: Report
105.article_body: French club PSG's reported contract with forward Kylian Mbappe, which runs till 2025, will see the player get €630 million by the end of it. The agreement reportedly states Mbappe's wages to be a net €72 million per annum, a signing bonus of €180 million and a loyalty bonus. Mbappe has scored 10 goals in the league this season.

106.title: Alibaba, Tencent shares stumble as Xi reshuffles China's politburo
106.article_body: As Xi Jinping began his third term as China's leader, he pushed market reformists from the politburo standing committee, leading to stocks of companies such as Alibaba and Tencent plunging 12% and 10% respectively. The Hang Seng stock index in Hong Kong was also the lowest since 2009 as it crashed by 6.2%. Investors fear tightened scrutiny of private companies.

107.title: Sensex jumps 525 points, Nifty ends above 17,700 during muhurat trading
107.article_body: The BSE and NSE on Monday conducted a one-hour special muhurat trading session from 6:15 pm, marking the beginning of Samvat 2079 - the Hindu calendar year that starts on Diwali. While the Sensex jumped 525 points to close at 59,832, the Nifty settled at 17,731 after rising 155 points. The gains were driven by the banking and financial stocks.

108.title: Ex-Tinkoff executives raise $16 mn to launch fintech startup
108.article_body: Three former executives at Tinkoff have raised $16 million to launch a fintech startup focused on Southeast Asia. The trio includes Co-founder George Chesakov, Pavel Fedorov, joint Tinkoff CEO in 2021-22 and Raffy Montemayor. Tinkoff is owned by London-listed TCS Group Holding and the company said that it was planning to expand to Asia a week before the Ukraine invasion.

109.title: Reliance shares rise after demerger announcement
109.article_body: Shares of Reliance Industries rose by 0.8% at ₹2,483.6 during the special muhurat trading session on October 24 after the company said that it will demerge and list its financial services business under Jio Financial Services. On October 21, RIL announced that shareholders will get one share of Jio Financial Services for each share they held in the company.

110.title: Qatar arrested & abused LGBT people ahead of FIFA World Cup: HRW
110.article_body: Human Rights Watch (HRW) said security forces in Qatar arbitrarily arrested and abused LGBT Qataris as recently as last month. A Qatari official responded that HRW's allegations "contain information that is categorically and unequivocally false". HRW said "nondiscrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity" should be for all and not just spectators going for the FIFA World Cup.

111.title: Mahindra tweets Churchill's quote from 1947 as Sunak set to become UK PM
111.article_body: Anand Mahindra reacted to Rishi Sunak's confirmation as UK's next PM through a tweet. "In 1947 on the cusp of Indian Independence, Winston Churchill supposedly said, "All Indian leaders will be of low calibre & men of straw"," tweeted Mahindra. "Today...during the 75th year of Independence...we're poised to see a man of Indian origin anointed as UK's PM," he added.

112.title: Kyiv urges global ban on Russia's RT after anchor's call to drown Ukrainian children
112.article_body: Ukraine has urged a global ban on the Russian channel RT after one of the channel's news anchors allegedly said that Ukrainian children who saw Russians as occupiers under Soviet Union should have been drowned. Ukraine has termed the channel an 'incitor of genocide'. RT's Editor-In-Chief Margarita Simonyan said she had suspended the presenter, Anton Krasovsky, for his "disgusting" comments.

113.title: Plane overshoots runway at airport in Philippines, nobody injured
113.article_body: A Korean Air passenger plane overshot the runway at the Mactan-Cebu International Airport in the Philippines late on Sunday, the airline informed. The 162 passengers and 11 crew members on board the aircraft escaped using emergency slides. The airport was closed in the aftermath of the incident as the aircraft remained stuck at the end of its lone usable runway.

114.title: Cheteshwar Pujara re-signs with Sussex for 2023 County season
114.article_body: Sussex have retained the services of India batter Cheteshwar Pujara for the 2023 season. "I am glad to be back with Sussex for the 2023 season. I thoroughly enjoyed my stint with the club last season," said Pujara. Last year, the batter scored over 1000 County Championship runs, including a record-breaking three double centuries, at an average of 109.4.

115.title: Cristiano Ronaldo only keen on joining a European club: Report
115.article_body: Journalist Fabrizio Romano said Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo is still keen to join a European club despite reports linking him to other leagues. "Ronaldo's priority has always been to continue in Europe. I'm sure his agent will explore the market in the next 1-2 months," said Romano. Ronaldo's contract with Manchester United expires at the end of the season.

116.title: B'luru residents form human chain to protest against potholes in city
116.article_body: Residents in Bengaluru have been complaining to the civic authorities regarding the pothole menace in the city. In a recent incident, residents of the city, including children and the elderly, formed a human chain on Sunday demanding an immediate solution to the potholed roads. According to the residents, they approached the civic authorities several times in the last six months.

117.title: Umpire made the right decision: Taufel on India's byes after Kohli got bowled on free hit
117.article_body: Former Australian umpire Simon Taufel stated that the umpire made the right decision in giving India three byes and not signalling a dead ball after Virat Kohli got out on free hit in last over against Pakistan. "For a free hit, the striker cannot be out bowled and therefore the ball is NOT dead on hitting the stumps," he stated.

118.title: SC revokes Gauhati HC order granting bail to accused arrested with morphine
118.article_body: The Supreme Court revoked a Gauhati High Court order granting bail to two men accused of possessing morphine. The accused were released on bail after being in jail for about a year. ''In our considered view, in the face of the mandate of Section 37 of the [NDPS] Act, the High Court...[shouldn't have granted] bail," the apex court said.

119.title: Two loud blasts heard in Syrian capital Damascus
119.article_body: Two blasts were heard across Syria's capital Damascus on Monday, and state media said they could have been caused by an Israeli strike. Israel has been carrying out strikes for years against what it calls Iranian and Iran-backed targets in Syria, where Tehran has stationed forces to support Syrian President Bashar al-Assad since the onset of the Syrian Civil War.

120.title: Rishi Sunak to become first UK Prime Minister of Indian descent
120.article_body: Rishi Sunak has won the race to be leader of the Conservative Party and will become UK's next Prime Minister. His only rival, Penny Mordaunt, conceded and withdrew on Monday. Sunak will become the first UK PM of Indian descent. Earlier, Liz Truss resigned from the post after 45 days in office amid massive economic crisis.

121.title: Girl dies after molestation attempt, Meerut Police probe university staff
121.article_body: The Meerut Police said that they are probing the role of the staff of a private university after a 19-year-old jumped off the fourth floor, following an alleged molestation attempt. The police said that the university did not inform them about the incident. According to the FIR, she was being pestered by another student, who allegedly molested her.

122.title: VCs of 9 universities can continue in their posts until Guv's final order: Kerala HC
122.article_body: The Kerala HC on Monday held that Vice-Chancellors of nine universities can continue in their positions until the Governor issues a final order following a show-cause notice that was issued on Monday. Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Monday issued notices to the VCs to show cause by November 3 on their legal right to continue in office.

123.title: 31-yr-old Pune man assaults police officer, tears his uniform; held
123.article_body: The Pune Police have arrested a 31-year-old man for allegedly assaulting a traffic police officer and tearing his uniform at Karachi Chowk in Pimpri. The incident took place on Saturday when the accused approached the officer for stopping the traffic flow from one direction and allegedly abused him. He then held the officer by his collar and tore his uniform.

124.title: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari seen with TMC leaders in Birbhum
124.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari was seen with two TMC councillors of Suri municipality at Bamni Kali Temple in West Bengal's Birbhum district. Calling the meeting a "coincidence", the TMC councillors Ujjwal Chatterjee and Kundan Dey said it was "without any political significance". Dey added, "We don't take politics to the temple. TMC has always been courteous to Opposition leaders."

125.title: Alpine F1 protest against Alonso being stripped of US GP points
125.article_body: Alpine F1 have protested against Haas's appeal about the safety of Fernando Alonso's car being upheld, leading to the driver losing his seventh place at the US Grand Prix. Haas had objected post-race to Alonso and Red Bull's Sergio Perez being allowed to continue racing with loose bodywork. Alpine said Haas lodged their protest 24 minutes past the specified deadline.

126.title: Tottenham lacks squad depth to challenge for PL and CL: Manager Conte
126.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte said his squad lacks depth to challenge for both the Premier League and Champions League titles. "My only worry at this moment is...that we don't have (more) injuries...this (lack of depth) is not something against the club, we knew this situation," said Conte. Tottenham remains third in the Premier League, five points behind leaders Arsenal.

127.title: Will gherao Odisha CM Patnaik's residence on Oct 31: State BJP
127.article_body: The BJP has threatened to gherao Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik's residence if action is not taken in the Archana Nag blackmailing case and the killing of a BJD Zilla Parishad member. BJP said the CM's residence will be gheraoed on October 31 if the Odisha Police failed to take action in 48 hours. They have also threatened a state-wide agitation.

128.title: Leopard attacks, kills 18-month-old girl in Mumbai's Aarey Colony
128.article_body: A leopard attacked and killed an 18-month-old girl in the forested area of Mumbai's Aarey Colony on Monday. The incident happened when the child followed her mother, who was on her way to a temple about 30 feet away from her house. The girl was injured by the leopard and was declared dead after she was taken to a hospital.

129.title: 2 people killed in accidents caused by Hurricane Roslyn in Mexico
129.article_body: Two people lost their lives on Sunday in accidents caused by Hurricane Roslyn after it made landfall along Mexico's Pacific coast, authorities said. Roslyn made landfall as a Category 3 hurricane in the Mexican state of Nayarit at 5:20 am (local time), the US National Hurricane Center informed. The hurricane later weakened into a tropical storm while moving inland.

130.title: Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif shot dead by mistake: Kenyan police
130.article_body: The killing of 50-year-old senior Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif in Nairobi was a case of "mistaken identity", Kenyan police said. Sharif was shot and killed by police after the car he was in sped up instead of halting at a roadblock near Nairobi, police said. The police were searching for a similar car involved in a case of child abduction.

131.title: Punjab records nearly 3,700 stubble burning cases over 5 weeks
131.article_body: Punjab recorded 3,696 stubble burning incidents between September 15 and October 22 with 60% being logged in the three districts of Tarn Taran, Amritsar and Gurdaspur. Tarn Taran reported 1,034 stubble burning incidents, followed by Amritsar at 895 and Gurdaspur at 324. "Paddy harvest is complete in 35% of the total cultivated area in Punjab," said an agriculture department official.

132.title: K’taka Minister gives gold, ₹1 lakh as Diwali gift to elected representatives
132.article_body: Karnataka Tourism Minister Anand Singh's Diwali gifts to elected municipal and panchayat members in the Hospet constituency has sparked a row. The picture of the box, which contained ₹1 lakh cash, 144 gm of gold, 1 kg of silver, a silk saree, a dhoti and a dry fruit box, went viral on social media.

133.title: Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif shot dead by police in Kenya
133.article_body: Arshad Sharif, a senior Pakistani journalist, was shot dead in Kenya when police hunting car thieves opened fire on the vehicle he was travelling in as it drove through their roadblock without stopping, according to Kenyan police. The incident took place at 10 pm on Sunday evening on the outskirts of Nairobi. Sharif's death has sparked widespread outrage in Pakistan.

134.title: 3% of Mumbai's women have hypertension, 2% have diabetes: BMC
134.article_body: A health campaign carried out by the BMC found that 3% of Mumbai's 18-plus woman population has hypertension while 2% has diabetes. In Mumbai, 2,13,177 women were screened for hypertension, while 2,05,345 were screened for diabetes. The 'Mata Surakshit Toh Ghar Surakshit' drive was to end on October 31 but has been extended to mid-November.

135.title: Snake found under bed at Telangana's MGM Hospital; video surfaces
135.article_body: A snake was found under a patient's bed in a ward of Mahatma Gandhi Memorial (MGM) Hospital in Telangana's Warangal. A video of the incident showed the snake slithering under the bed in the second such incident reported from the hospital in less than two weeks. A patient's attendant had, on October 13, found a cobra inside MGM Hospital's washroom.

136.title: Aliens do walk among us: Wasim Akram on Virat Kohli after India's win over Pakistan
136.article_body: After Virat Kohli helped India defeat Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday, former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "Aliens do walk among us, he's one of the best I've seen in the recent or modern greats." Akram added, "He has been scoring for the last 15 years, and he has the best average while chasing."

137.title: Kohli praises Ashwin for leaving ball in last over, says 'Dimag ke upar extra dimag lagaya'
137.article_body: Virat Kohli praised Ravichandran Ashwin for leaving a delivery bowled by Pakistan's Muhammad Nawaz in last over, which went on to be a wide. He said, "I told Ashwin to hit...ball over covers. But Ash...usne dimaag ke upar extra dimag lagaya. That was a brave thing for him to do...Ball came inside the line and he turned it into wide."

138.title: Inspection done at Pune Railway Station, additional staff deployed
138.article_body: After a Bihar labourer lost his life due to heavy crowds at the Pune Railway station, a detailed inspection was carried by the Pune Railway Division and the Railway Protection Force (RPF) police.  The Pune Railway Division also deployed additional manpower of RPF policemen and other railway staff at all platforms. They reviewed security arrangements and the crowd was monitored.

139.title: We are prepared to tackle incidents on Diwali: Delhi Fire Service
139.article_body: Even though it is illegal to burst firecrackers in the national capital, the Delhi Fire Service (DFS) has made all the arrangements to handle fire occurrences on Diwali. "We are prepared with drones and to access high-rise buildings. Fire tenders have been deployed near congested areas. However, we expect there will not be many fire-related incidents," chief of DFS said.

140.title: Coimbatore cylinder blast definite act of terror by fidayeen: Report
140.article_body: The cylinder blast in Coimbatore is a definite act of terror by fidayeen, reports said. Jamesha Mubin, who was killed in the cylinder blast on Sunday, had written "if the news about my death reaches you, forgive my mistakes, hide my shortcomings, participate in 'Janaasa' and pray for me" on the display of his mobile phone, reports added.

141.title: Hasan Minhaj points out his resemblance to Suryakumar in graphic shared by ICC
141.article_body: Comedian Hasan Minhaj took to Twitter to point out his resemblance to Suryakumar Yadav in a  graphic of the Indian cricketer shared by the ICC. Reacting to the cricketer's graphic, the comedian tweeted, "Pls tag me next time ICC." Several Twitter users agreed that the two resembled each other, with a user tweeting, "Separated at birth?"

142.title: Protestors throw chocolate cake on King Charles III's wax statue in UK
142.article_body: Two supporters of 'Just Stop Oil' attacked a Madame Tussauds waxwork model of King Charles III with chocolate cake in London. The protestors demanded that the UK government halts all new oil and gas licences and consent. "The science is clear. The demand is simple: just stop new oil and gas. It's a piece of cake," the protestors said.

143.title: Fitbit sued in Australia over refund policy on faulty devices
143.article_body: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) began court proceedings against Fitbit for misleading consumers about faulty devices. Fitbit has come under fire for claiming that consumers won't get refunded unless they return faulty products within 45 days of purchase, which is against Australian Consumer Law. The ACCC said that 58 consumers were allegedly misled by Fitbit.

144.title: We've been lot more nicer in this season: Bani on 'Four...' co-stars
144.article_body: Speaking about the bond between 'Four More Shots Please!' co-stars, actress Bani J has said they have been a lot "nicer" in the third season. "(We have been) a lot more of understanding," she added. "Somebody said tolerance the other day, but it's not tolerance. It's more of an understanding like...'let her be'. That kind of an understanding," Bani stated.

145.title: BJP leader Rapolu Bhaskar quits party, set to join ruling TRS
145.article_body: Ahead of the Munugode bypolls, BJP leader Rapolu Ananda Bhaskar resigned from the party and is set to join the ruling TRS on Monday. He expressed disappointment over the Centre’s decision to levy GST on handlooms and said that he appreciated CM KCR’s measures to enhance the condition of weavers in the state.

146.title: PWD proposes ₹12 crore budget to govt for Mumbai’s JJ Hospital renovation
146.article_body: The Maharashtra State Human Rights Commission (MSHRC) has directed the PWD to start repairs in Mumbai's JJ Hospital immediately. The PWD, according to a junior officer, has submitted a report to the government with a proposed budget of ₹12.66 crore. MSHRC said they have been receiving complaints about the hospital's infrastructure from resident doctors for a "long time".

147.title: People started taking me seriously after 'Four More...': Maanvi Gagroo
147.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo has said that people started taking her seriously after her series 'Four More Shots Please!'. "Till 'Four More Shots Please!' happened I was getting roles that were girl-next-door," she stated. Maanvi added that the show also helped with her social media following. "The kind of offers I'm getting now are interesting...Thankfully...I can pick and choose," she said.

148.title: Kerala HC’s special hearing on VCs’ petition against Governor order
148.article_body: The Vice-Chancellors of nine universities of Kerala, who were asked to resign by the Governor's Office, have approached the Kerala High Court. The High Court will hold a special sitting at 4 pm on Monday to consider the petition. "I have received the decision...but I will not submit my resignation...This is a fake accusation," said Kannur University VC Gopinath Ravindar.

149.title: Ugandan capital's Ebola tally reaches 14 with 9 new confirmed cases
149.article_body: Nine more people tested positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala on Sunday, the Ugandan Health Ministry said on Monday, taking the city's number of confirmed cases reported since Saturday to 14. All the patients who have tested positive were in isolation when they became symptomatic, the ministry said. The current Ebola outbreak in Uganda began in September.

150.title: French court approves €238 million Credit Suisse settlement
150.article_body: A French court approved a €238 million (₹19.37 lakh crore) settlement between Credit Suisse Group and the French financial prosecution office to settle a tax fraud and money laundering case. Under the terms of the agreement, the Swiss bank makes no admission of guilt. The settlement will see the bank pay a fine of €123 million to the state.

151.title: B'luru couple finds burglar dead in their pooja room after returning from Europe trip
151.article_body: A couple from Bengaluru who returned from a Europe trip found the dead body of a man in the puja room of their house. A CCTV camera footage shows that the burglar ate from the kitchen, took a shower and slept in the bedroom before dying by suicide. Police said he had been arrested in various house theft cases.

152.title: Opp'n claims Tripura minister’s son involved in 16-yr-old’s gangrape
152.article_body: Three people, including a woman, have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the gangrape of a 16-year-old girl in Tripura's Unakoti district. The opposition Congress and CPI(M) have claimed that a state minister's son was involved in the incident and called for his arrest. The girl was allegedly gang-raped in a three-storey building in Kumarghat on October 19.

153.title: B'luru couple finds burglar dead in their pooja room after returning from Europe trip
153.article_body: A couple from Bengaluru who returned from a Europe trip found the dead body of a man in the puja room of their house. A CCTV camera footage shows that the burglar ate from the kitchen, took a shower and slept in the bedroom before dying by suicide. Police said he had been arrested in various house theft cases.

154.title: Starlink won't be turned off even without funding: Musk to Ukrainian Vice PM
154.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk on Monday reassured Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov that his firm SpaceX "would not turn off Starlink even if [US Department of Defence] refused to provide funding". Musk was replying to media reports claiming some European Union countries may fund Starlink services in Ukraine. "Thanks Musk...This was critically important for Ukraine. We're grateful to you!" Fedorov said.

155.title: 4 pose as policemen & rob Mumbai beautician of cash, valuables worth ₹7 lakh
155.article_body: Mumbai Police on Saturday arrested three people, including a woman, who allegedly posed as police officers and barged into a beautician's house, robbing her of cash and valuables worth over ₹7 lakh. The police, during the interrogation, learned that the victim's family friend had informed the accused about the valuables, following which a plan was hatched, a police officer said.

156.title: US, UK warn of possible terror attack in Nigeria's capital Abuja
156.article_body: The US and Britain on Sunday warned their citizens in Nigeria about a possible terror attack in the country's capital, Abuja, aimed at government buildings and tourist attractions, among other targets. Nigeria has been battling an Islamist insurgency since 2009, primarily in the northeast. In July, however, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for a major prison raid in Abuja.

157.title: Mumbai gang clones debit cards, withdraws ₹6.47 lakh in 58 transactions
157.article_body: A gang in Mumbai withdrew ₹6.47 lakh through 58 transactions in three days. Using cloned debit cards, the gang withdrew ₹500 on October 4, ₹4.9 lakh in 49 transactions on October 5 and ₹70,000 in seven transactions on October 6 from an ATM in Marol. They also withdrew ₹87,000 in two transactions from an ATM in Chakala on October 5-6.

158.title: India break world record for winning most matches in int'l cricket in a calendar year
158.article_body: The last-ball four-wicket victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday was India's 39th victory in international cricket in 2022. With this, India broke the world record for winning the most number of matches in international cricket in a calendar year. The previous record was held by Australia, who had won 38 matches in 2003.

159.title: Fans will watch film that appeals to them: Akshay on Ram Setu-Thank God clash
159.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about the clash between his film 'Ram Setu' and Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Thank God', has said that there is no clash. "Fans will choose to watch the one that appeals to them the most or better...watch both," he stated. Akshay added, "The main objective is for...fans to enjoy the festival at the movies with friends and family."

160.title: Delhi man dies after his parked SUV catches fire in Alipur
160.article_body: A man was burnt alive after his parked SUV caught fire in Delhi's Alipur area on Sunday. The victim has not yet been identified as only his bones remained after the fire. "The car is registered in the name of a person who lives in Kurukshetra [in Haryana]. A police team has been sent...for further inquiry," police said.

161.title: 'Kantara' beats 'KGF: Chapter 1', becomes 2nd highest-grossing Kannada film
161.article_body: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' has earned around ₹188 crore worldwide since its release, making it the second highest-grossing Kannada film. The film went past Yash's 'KGF: Chapter 1'. However, 'KGF: Chapter 2' is still the highest-grossing Kannada film. In India, Kantara has earned ₹170.50 crore, with the film earning ₹111.25 crore in Karnataka.

162.title: Celebrate Diwali with deprived people, UP CM tells officers & employees
162.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath extended Diwali greetings on Monday and urged officers and employees to celebrate the festival with the deprived and needy people. In a tweet, CM Adityanath said that it should be our endeavour to illuminate every house with the spirit of harmony, adding that there should be 'Ramatv' all around.

163.title: North Korea and South Korea exchange warning shots near sea border
163.article_body: North and South Korea exchanged warning shots off the western coast of the Korean Peninsula on Monday. Seoul said its forces fired warning shots to repel a North Korean merchant vessel that had breached the Northern Limit Line (NLL), the de facto sea boundary between the two countries. Meanwhile, Pyongyang accused a South Korean naval ship of violating the NLL.

164.title: OTTs, social media platforms may pay access charge to telcos: Report
164.article_body: Social media platforms like WhatsApp, Facebook and Twitter, along with over-the-top (OTT) firms like Netflix, Prime Video and Disney+Hotstar, may reportedly have to pay carriage charge to telecom operators. As data grows, telecom service providers have to keep increasing their carriage capacity and backhaul networks, which requires investment. The draft Telecom Bill may adopt this regulation.

165.title: That's why they won the match: Babar on journalist's 'Kohli was the difference' remark
165.article_body: During the press conference following Pakistan's defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022, a journalist, while asking a question, remarked Virat Kohli was the difference between the two sides. Pakistan captain Babar Azam interrupted the journalist and said, "That's why they won the match." He further said that Kohli's 53-ball 82* knock will give the India batter "more confidence".

166.title: WWE's Heyman shares Kohli's pic, jokes 'He acknowledged our tribal chief Reigns'
166.article_body: WWE wrestler Roman Reigns' special counsel Paul Heyman shared a picture of Virat Kohli from celebrations following India's win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. He jokingly wrote, "It's with great honor that I, #SpecialCounsel and #Wiseman to #Bloodline, accept the great @imVkohli's celebration as, in front of the world, he decided to acknowledge our tribal chief @WWERomanReigns."

167.title: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw passes away
167.article_body: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw passed away on Monday. He was the former Vice Chairman of Biocon. John, a member of Biocon's board of directors since 1999, was a foreign promoter and on the advisory board of various Biocon group companies, according to the company's website.

168.title: Delhi was most polluted city in the world, not anymore: Kejriwal
168.article_body: After Delhi was not featured on the list of the top 10 most polluted cities of Asia, CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "Some years back, [Delhi] was the most polluted city in the world. Not anymore!" Lauding the people of the city, he added "While we have improved, there is still a long way to go".

169.title: India will always seek to strengthen UN's effectiveness: S Jaishankar
169.article_body: On the 77th anniversary of the United Nations, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar claimed that India will always seek to strengthen the UN's effectiveness. "India’s ongoing tenure as a member of the Security Council has reflected our principled approach of promoting dialogue and diplomacy to meet contemporary challenges. We will always stand with the Global South," tweeted Jaishankar.

170.title: After 'Tanhaji', I was offered to play Shivaji Maharaj many times: Sharad
170.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar revealed he was offered the role of Shivaji Maharaj many times after his portrayal of the character in Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Tanhaji'.  "I responded by asking 'How many films will I do with the same character?' And they said that they feel I would do justice to the character," he added. Sharad will feature in 'Har Har Mahadev'.

171.title: Multiple subways in B'luru continue to remain submerged despite no rains
171.article_body: Multiple subways in Bengaluru continued to remain filled with water despite the city witnessing no rains in the past few days. Commuters complained that many pedestrian subways, including the Nrupathunga Road and Raj Bhavan Road subways, were inaccessible due to the water. "It has been over three days. There is no action from the authorities," a resident said.

172.title: China's GDP grows by 3.9% Y-o-Y in July-September quarter
172.article_body: The GDP of China showed a 3.9% year-on-year growth in the July-September quarter, amid a raft of government measure. However, domestic demand declined towards the end of the quarter due to persistent COVID-19 restrictions, a prolonged property slump and global recession risks. In the nine months to September, China's inflation-adjusted urban per capita consumption fell 0.2% on year.

173.title: World's largest diya lit up in Punjab's Mohali; pic surfaces
173.article_body: The world's largest diya was lit up in Punjab's Mohali amid Diwali festivities. More than 10,000 people contributed 3,560 litres of oil for an event to light up the diya made with 1,000 kilograms of steel. The diya, which was recognised as the world's largest by the Guinness World Records, measures 3.37 metres in diameter.

174.title: 258 people arrested in Chhattisgarh for luring people into online betting
174.article_body: Chhattisgarh Police has arrested 258 people in 25 cases over the past month for operating centres to lure people into online betting via online application 'Mahadev'. The application was launched by group of people operating out of Dubai. "They opened around 30 centres, mostly in Chhattisgarh, and over ₹200 crores of transactions happen from each of these centres," police said.

175.title: Mumbai Police turn 'bhajiwala', 'doodhwala' to crack 30-yr-old assault case
