175.article_body: Mumbai Police cracked a 30-year-old assault case and arrested a 57-year-old man for allegedly assaulting a woman in 1993. Police posed as milkmen, vegetable vendors, courier boys and postmen to nab the accused, who was taken into custody on October 20. The accused had attacked the victim with a chopper and was on the Mumbai Police's most wanted list.

176.title: 2 bodies found after plane carrying Gold's Gym owner crashed off Costa Rica
176.article_body: Two dead bodies were recovered by Costa Rican authorities on Sunday during their search for people who were on board a small plane that crashed in the Caribbean Sea on Friday. Rainer Schaller, the owner of fitness chains Gold's Gym and McFit, and five others were listed as being on the aircraft. The recovered bodies could not be identified immediately.

177.title: Jindal Group to enter lending business with ₹400 crore investment
177.article_body: Gaurav Sachdeva, the Chief Executive Officer of JSW One Platforms (JSWOP), said the JSW group will enter the lending space with an investment of up to ₹400 crore in a non-bank finance company (NBFC). The NBFC will be a subsidiary of JSWOP. Sachdeva said the NBFC can help other JSW companies like cement, steel, or paints by offering financing solutions.

178.title: Russian oil supplies to China in Sept rise 22% YoY, second to Saudi
178.article_body: Russian oil supplies to China in September 2022 rose 22% YoY while Saudi Arabia remained the top oil supplier to China. Russian supplies in September totalled 7.46 million tonnes, equivalent to 1.82 million barrels per day (bpd), data from Chinese General Administration of Customs showed. This is down from the record high of nearly 2 million bpd imported in May.

179.title: Notice asks women lawyers to not 'arrange hair in open court' in Pune; pic shared
179.article_body: Senior Supreme Court advocate Indira Jaising has shared a picture of a Pune court notice that asked women advocates to refrain from arranging their hair. "It's repeatedly noticed that women advocates are arranging their hair in open Court, which is disturbing the functioning of the Court," it read. "Wow now look! Who's distracted by women advocates and why," Jaising wrote.

180.title: Major fire breaks out at drugs manufacturing unit in Chennai
180.article_body: A major fire broke out at a private drugs manufacturing unit in Tamil Nadu's Chennai on Monday. The fire department received the information about the fire at around 8.15 am and several fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The fire engulfed the entire building and several vehicles parked near the firm were also charred.

181.title: Taskin records his career-best T20I figures as B'desh defeat Netherlands
181.article_body: Bangladesh defeated Netherlands by nine runs in their T20 World Cup Super 12 stage match on Monday. Batting first, Bangladesh posted a total of 144/8, with Afif Hossain (38 off 27) being the top-scorer for the side. Netherlands were eventually bowled out for 135 runs as Bangladesh pacer Taskin Ahmed registered his career-best T20I figures of 4-0-25-4 in the match.

182.title: People asked me, 'Hero kaun hai?' I replied 'me': Janhvi Kapoor on 'Mili'
182.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said whenever she tells people she's working on a female-oriented film, they address it "like it's an anomaly". She asked if they'd ask an actor their feeling about doing a male-oriented film if her upcoming film 'Mili' was called 'Milan'. "Many times, when I'm doing this film, I'm asked, 'Hero kaun hai?'...I answer 'Me'," she stated.

183.title: Power connection of Bhagat Singh's house never disconnected: Administration
183.article_body: The district administration of Shaheed Bhagat Singh Nagar, Punjab, rejected reports that the power connection of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's ancestral house was disconnected. "In fact, Powercom has an advance bill payment worth ₹6,760 with them," Deputy Commissioner Navjot Singh said. He also made an appeal to the media not to use the name of Bhagat Singh's ancestral house.

184.title: At least 220 killed in tribal clashes in southern Sudan
184.article_body: At least 220 people were killed in two days of tribal fighting as of Saturday night in Sudan's southern Blue Nile province, a senior health official said on Sunday. The clashes erupted in the town of Wad el-Mahi due to a land dispute between two tribes. A 30-day state of emergency has been declared in the Blue Nile province.

185.title: Why was Karthik given out despite Rizwan collecting ball in front of wickets?
185.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik was stumped out by Pakistan wicketkeeper Muhammad Rizwan on the bowling of Muhammad Nawaz in the last over despite Rizwan collecting the ball in front of wickets. The ball wasn't called a no-ball as the ball had hit Karthik's pads before reaching Rizwan. As per MCC's Law 27.3.1, Rizwan's collection of the ball was legitimate.

186.title: Delhi LG VK Saxena, CM Arvind Kejriwal wish people on Diwali
186.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena and Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday wished happiness and prosperity to the people of the national capital on Diwali. The LG also urged everyone to follow precautionary measures for COVID-19 and pollution while celebrating the festival. Arvind Kejriwal took to Twitter and said, "May goddess Laxmi always reside in your house."

187.title: Woman steals gold worth ₹12 lakh from 54-yr-old cousin in Mumbai
187.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly stealing gold ornaments worth ₹12 lakh from her 54-year-old cousin's house in Mumbai. The accused first visited her cousin on September 24. She again visited on September 30 and used her cousin's bedroom to change clothes. The complainant noticed the absence of her ornaments on October 9, resulting in her filing a complaint.

188.title: I broke up with Julia as I was scared she'd leave me: 'Friends' star Matthew
188.article_body: 'Friends' star Matthew Perry in his forthcoming memoir revealed that he dated actress Julia Roberts for a few months. "Dating Julia Roberts had been too much for me. I'd been constantly certain that she was going to break up with me," he wrote. "So instead of facing the inevitable agony of losing her, I broke up with her," he added.

189.title: 'We all lost as a team', says Babar Azam to Pak cricket team; PCB shares video
189.article_body: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam addressed the Pakistan cricket team after it was defeated by India in the T20 World Cup match in Melbourne on Sunday. In a video shared by Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), Azam told the team, "We all lost as a team. Nobody should point fingers at one person, this shouldn't happen, not in this team," he added.

190.title: PM participates in 'Vande Mataram' sing-along with jawans in Kargil on Diwali
190.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who is in Kargil celebrating Diwali with Army Jawans, took part in a 'Vande Mataram' sing-along with members of the Armed Forces. PM Modi can be seen clapping and humming the song in a video, while several jawans can be seen playing musical instruments. PM landed in Kargil on Monday to celebrate Diwali with jawans.

191.title: Brazilian President's ally throws grenades at police to evade arrest, 2 officers injured
191.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's ally Roberto Jefferson threw grenades at police officers who arrived at his residence in Rio de Janeiro to arrest him on Sunday. Two police officers were injured and taken to a hospital. A Supreme Court judge earlier ordered his detention for insulting Chief Justice Carmen Lucia. President Bolsonaro condemned the armed attack.

192.title: DRI seizes narcotics worth ₹15 cr from Mumbai airport cargo; 3 held
192.article_body: Officials of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested three persons, including a Nigerian national and seized narcotics worth ₹15 crore from the Mumbai international airport cargo. The officials recovered 1.9 kg of Amphetamine Type Substance (ATS) as tablets, which were packed in polythene packs concealed inside the body of the corrugated packaging material, an official said.

193.title: 28-yr-old punched, hit with belt by 3 for 'staring' at 1 of them in Mumbai
193.article_body: A 28-year-old man was allegedly killed by three persons following a dispute over staring at one of them in Mumbai, a police official said on Monday. The official said that the accused allegedly hit the victim on his head with a belt, punched him and also hurled abuses. The incident took place on Sunday.

194.title: College students wear 'anti-cheating' hats, masks during exams in Philippines; pics viral
194.article_body: Pictures of college students wearing 'anti-cheating' hats and masks in the Philippines have gone viral on social media. A professor of mechanical engineering at Bicol University College of Engineering shared the pictures and wrote, "Midterm Exam Moments." The students created homemade hats and masks out of cardboard, egg boxes and other recycled materials.

195.title: Met John Abraham as courier boy, it was life-defining: Harshvardhan Rane
195.article_body: Actor Harshvardhan Rane revealed he met John Abraham as a courier boy to deliver the latter a Yamaha helmet. "It was a life-defining moment...he made me comfortable. He invited me to the event for which he had flown to Delhi. He...gave me his mobile number," he added. Harshvardhan said he still doesn't have the "guts" to call John.

196.title: Dravid sir told me to be calm, I said 'Sir, I'm just happy to be here': Hardik
196.article_body: In a conversation with Virat Kohli after their win against Pakistan in the 2022 T20 World Cup, Hardik Pandya revealed that coach Rahul Dravid, when he was coming in to bat, told him to "just be calm". Hardik added, "So, I just had to tell him that, 'Sir, please understand I am just happy to be here'."

197.title: Massive fire breaks out at a house in Itanagar, causes damage worth lakhs
197.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a house in Naharlagun, a town in Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar district, resulting in "damage worth lakhs". "The fire completely burnt 15 rooms of the rented kutcha house unit...along with...important documents," said the house's owner Mena. There have been no casualties reported so far. There's no information available over the reason behind this incident.

198.title: ICC shares video of fans chanting 'Chak De India' in stadium after India beats Pak
198.article_body: ICC took to social media to share a video that showed fans at the Melbourne Cricket Ground chanting 'Chak De India' after India beat Pakistan in the T20 World Cup match. The video also showed the fans whistling and cheering for Virat Kohli, who smashed 82*(53). "Raw vision: Behind the scenes of India's sensational win," ICC captioned the video.

199.title: 34-year-old man dies of cardiac arrest while watching India-Pakistan match in Assam
199.article_body: A 34-year-old man identified as Bitu Gogoi passed away after suffering cardiac arrest while watching India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match in Assam's Sivasagar district. Bitu was watching the match at a local cinema hall with his friends when he suddenly became unconscious and fell down. He was rushed to a local hospital, where the doctors declared him brought dead.

200.title: Philips announces 4,000 job cuts, CEO says 'difficult, but necessary decision'
200.article_body: Dutch medical equipment maker Philips announced 4,000 job cuts following a massive recall of respiratory machines that slashed around 70% off its market value in the past year. Philips CEO Roy Jakobs called the decision "difficult, but necessary". "My immediate priority is to improve execution so that we can start rebuilding the trust of patients, consumers and customers," he added.

201.title: HC quashes case against boy who accidentally crashed cycle into old woman
201.article_body: The Bombay High Court quashed a case that had been filed against a 10-year-old boy, who had accidentally caused injuries to a 62-year-old woman by crashing into her while cycling. It also ordered the state government to provide compensation of ₹25,000 to the boy and his mother. The  amount will be recovered from the police officers involved in the case.

202.title: Akshay's 'Ram Setu' is convergence of science, history, Ramayana: Director
202.article_body: Director Abhishek Sharma said Akshay Kumar's 'Ram Setu' is a convergence of science, history, geography and Ramayana. As per the film's producer Vikram Malhotra, Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi "played an important part in bridging the areas of history and spirituality with his extensive research over decades". Dr Dwivedi, who directed Akshay's 'Samrat Prithviraj', was brought in as a creative producer.

203.title: 4-year-old shot dead in Agra, father's friend held
203.article_body: A four-year-old boy was kidnapped and later shot dead allegedly by his father's friend in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. According to reports, the accused tried to mislead the family of the victim by helping in search for the boy and recovering the body. The weapon used has been recovered but the motive is yet to be ascertained, said police.

204.title: Sudarsan Pattnaik sculpts Goddess Kali's sand art with 4,045 diyas
204.article_body: Renowned sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik has created a 5-foot-high sand art of Goddess Kali by using 4,045 diyas with the message, "Let us burn out all the negativity," at the Puri beach in Odisha. "This Diwali, I want to appeal to people to keep our environment clean and pollution free," said Pattnaik.

205.title: Cong criticises K'taka govt for spending ₹4.5 crore on a promotional video
205.article_body: The Karnataka Congress criticised the state government for spending around ₹4.5 crore on a 5-minute video to promote the upcoming Global Investors Meet (GIM) in Bengaluru. Congress MLA Priyank Kharge said that the government, which has failed to provide jobs, is spending an exorbitant amount on promotion. The Global Investors Meet is scheduled from November 2 to November 4.

206.title: 25-yr-old journalist dies after falling into under-construction stormwater drain in Chennai
206.article_body: A 25-year-old journalist working with a private news channel in Tamil Nadu's Chennai died after falling into an under-construction stormwater drain while returning home from work. He apparently tried to leap over the trench. He was taken to VH hospital and later shifted to Government Royapettah Hospital, where he succumbed to the injuries.

207.title: Rohit Sharma mimics journalist during presser after win vs Pakistan, video goes viral
207.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma mimicked a journalist during the press conference following last-ball win against Pakistan. A video of the same has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen answering in the journalist's accent. "I felt really good, I felt really good," Rohit said while mimicking. People present at the press conference were then heard laughing.

208.title: Video of Melbourne Cricket Ground echoing with Indian National Anthem goes viral
208.article_body: A video has gone viral showing thousands of Indian fans singing the National Anthem ahead of India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. The official Twitter handle of the Mumbai Police shared a video taken by a fan, writing, "The country and anthem we all rise up for." More than 90,000 spectators attended the match.

209.title: Governor seeking VCs' resignations is undemocratic: Kerala CM Vijayan
209.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has termed state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan seeking resignations of Vice-Chancellors of nine universities in the state as "undemocratic". Vijayan added, "Governor's post is not to move against the government, but to uphold constitution's dignity. He's acting as a tool of RSS." Governor Arif had directed VCs to send him resignations by 11.30 am on Monday.

210.title: Apple CEO shares Diwali pic clicked by Mumbai photographer, calls it 'beautiful'
210.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook on Monday shared a picture clicked by Mumbai-based photographer Apeksha Maker. "This photo beautifully captures why Diwali is known as the Festival of Lights. Wishing all who celebrate a holiday full of joy and prosperity," he tweeted. The photographer said she was "humbled" to see Cook share the image.

211.title: 5 family members killed as car rams into truck in UP's Basti
211.article_body: Five members of a family were killed after their car rammed into a container truck in UP's Basti district on Sunday. The victims include a 60-year-old man called Sanjeev Kumar, a 40-year-old woman named Ankita, his 17-year-old son and 14-year-old daughter. Another 40-year-old woman died in the accident. The family was travelling to UP's Sant Kabir Nagar district from Lucknow.

212.title: Prabhas fans cause fire at theatre after bursting firecrackers on his b'day
212.article_body: A fire broke out at Venkatramana theatre in Andhra Pradesh after fans of actor Prabhas burst firecrackers during the screening of the 2009 film 'Billa' on the occasion of the actor's birthday. The seats in the theatre caught fire, however, it was put out by theatre employees and movie watchers. No casualties were reported from the incident.

213.title: Minor boy tied to pole & beaten up on suspicion of theft in UP; video surfaces
213.article_body: Three men tied a minor boy to a pole and thrashed him on the suspicion of theft in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh district. A video of the incident shows one of the men tying the boy's hands and legs. The Azamgarh Police said it has arrested all three accused, who are aged 32, 45, and 52 years.

214.title: Can't have better Diwali than being with you: PM to soldiers in Kargil
214.article_body: PM Narendra Modi reached Jammu and Kashmir's Kargil to celebrate Diwali with jawans on Monday. "I cannot have a better Diwali than being with you," he said, adding that Diwali means "festival of end of terror" and Kargil has made it possible. "A country is actually proud when its soldiers' heads are as high as the Himalayas," PM Modi added.

215.title: Cyclone 'Sitrang' to intensify into severe cyclonic storm by tonight
215.article_body: Cyclone 'Sitrang' is very likely to intensify into a severe cyclonic storm in next 12 hours and continue its movement, the India Meteorological Department said on Monday. It is likely to cross Bangladesh coast between Tinkona Island and Sandwip early Tuesday. North coastal Odisha is expected to receive heavy rainfall, while heavy to very heavy rainfall is expected over Bengal.

216.title: It was redemption for him in one way: Jaffer on Arshdeep's 3/32 vs Pak
216.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has praised India pacer Arshdeep Singh for registering figures of 3/32 against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup match. "It was redemption for him (Arshdeep) in one way," said Jaffer. Arshdeep had faced online abuse for dropping Asif Ali's catch in India's defeat against Pakistan in their Asia Cup Super 4 match last month.

217.title: 26,000 people visit Byculla Zoo over Diwali weekend, generates ₹10L
217.article_body: A revenue of ₹10 lakh was generated after 26,000 people visited the Byculla Zoo in Mumbai over the Diwali weekend. "Almost 18,000 visitors were recorded on Sunday," said the zoo director Dr Sanjay Tripathi. The zoo has undergone a revamp over the last few years with new exotic animals brought from different places to enhance the experience.

218.title: 25-yr-old Mumbai businessman jailed after pulling 16-yr-old's hair, calling her 'item'
218.article_body: A 25-year-old Mumbai businessman has been sentenced to 1.5 years in jail for harassing a 16-year-old school student. The man in 2015 had pulled the girl's hair and told her, "Kya item, kidhar ja rahi ho?" The POCSO court ruled that the word "item" to address a girl is used in the context of objectifying her sexually and nothing else.

219.title: ICC shares video of Ashwin hitting match-winning run, Dravid's reaction goes viral
219.article_body: The ICC has shared a video of India's Ravichandran Ashwin hitting the match-winning run against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022. The video shows reactions of Indian players and support staff from the dugout. Team India head coach Rahul Dravid's animated reaction has gone viral. "If Rahul Dravid is celebrating...it means it's really special," a fan commented on Instagram.

220.title: Google CEO Pichai celebrates India's win over Pak, responds to troll on Twitter
220.article_body: Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai on Monday tweeted, "Happy Diwali!...I celebrated by watching the last three overs again today, what a game and performance #Diwali #TeamIndia #T20WC2022." When a troll tweeted, "You should watch 1st three overs," Pichai responded by tweeting, "Did that too...what a spell from Bhuvi and Arshdeep." India beat Pakistan by 4 wickets on Sunday.

221.title: BCCI shares video of Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya's interaction after Pakistan match
221.article_body: The BCCI has shared a video of Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya's interaction after India's last-ball victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. In the video, Pandya can be heard telling Kohli, "I would have taken a bullet for you, but I wouldn't have let you get out." Kohli and Pandya shared a 113-run stand for the fifth wicket.

222.title: Russian fighter jet crashes into house in Russia as both pilots 'suffocate in cockpit'
222.article_body: A Su-30 Russian warplane crashed into a house in Russia on Sunday, killing two people. The casualties were believed to be the pilots as earlier reports suggest they had suffocated in the cockpit during the test flight. The plane fell nose-first into a suburb of Irkutsk city. Three children were said to have been evacuated from the building.

223.title: Invite from The White House has come as true surprise: Karsh Kale
223.article_body: Indian-American music composer Karsh Kale has reacted to being invited to The White House for Diwali celebrations. "After three challenging years of the pandemic, this invite has come as a true surprise," he stated. This is the second time Karsh has been invited to The White House. He was first invited in 2013 under the tenure of ex-President Barack Obama.

224.title: Virat Kohli, the name is enough: Wahab Riaz on Kohli's innings vs Pakistan
224.article_body: Pakistan pacer Wahab Riaz said the India-Pakistan match in the T20 World Cup on Sunday was "intense" and the "better team won". Riaz also praised Virat Kohli for his match-winning innings, tweeting, "Kohli, naam hi kaaafii haa, (Kohli, the name is enough)." Former Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez also praised Kohli, tweeting, "It was special innings from a very special player."

225.title: To my B'wood friends: Kangana on 'If I hurt you, you deserve it' meme
225.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, actress Kangana Ranaut shared a meme, which read, "To anybody, I hurt this year, you deserve it." Along with the meme, the actress wrote, "Now that the year is ending, I want to confess something similar to my Bollywood friends." Kangana, who recently starred in 'Dhaakad', will feature in 'Emergency'.

226.title: 20 wagons of coal-laden goods train derail in Maharashtra; multiple trains cancelled
226.article_body: As many as 20 wagons of a coal-laden goods train derailed in Maharashtra's Amravati district late Sunday night. There was no report of any casualty in the incident that took place between Malkhed and Timtala stations. After the derailment, several passenger trains have been cancelled or diverted, railway officials said on Monday.

227.title: India reports 1,334 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 23,193
227.article_body: India reported 1,334 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,994 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases now stand at 23,193. The data showed that 1,557 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,977.

228.title: Two people arrested for sale of illegal firecrackers in Noida
228.article_body: In two separate raids, Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested two people for storage and sale of illegal firecrackers. Huge quantity of firecrackers was seized from both the suspects. Cases have been registered against them under various Sections of the Explosives Act. "Police will take strict action if any offenders are caught," said Gautam Buddha Nagar's District Magistrate.

229.title: I'll not do it: Kannur University VC on Kerala Governor seeking resignation
229.article_body: After Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan sought resignations of Vice-Chancellors of nine universities in the state, Kannur University Vice-Chancellor Dr Gopinath Ravindran, who's among the nine VCs, said he'll not resign. "A VC's resignation is based on financial irregularities and bad behaviour, neither of which has happened," he said. Kerala Education Minister has criticised Governor's move.

230.title: Delhi Police arrest 29 people for gambling, seize ₹58 lakh
230.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 29 people, including 7 women, for gambling at a hotel in the Punjabi Bagh area on Sunday. They also recovered over ₹58 lakh and 10 sets of playing cards. "On October 22, specific inputs were received that a large number of people were assembling at the hotel for...gambling at the banquet hall," said DCP Ghanshyam Bansal.

231.title: Saw a tear in Virat's eyes, this was unforgettable: Harsha Bhogle on India's win over Pak
231.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's match-winning knock of 82*(53) against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "I've seen Virat for so many years. I've never seen a tear in his eyes. I saw it today. This was unforgettable." Kohli broke down after helping India beat Pakistan. India scored 16 runs in last over to win the match.

232.title: What records did Virat Kohli break in match against Pakistan?
232.article_body: With his 82*(53) against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, Virat Kohli became the leading run-scorer in T20I cricket with 3,794 runs. With 24 fifty-plus scores, Kohli broke Sachin Tendulkar's record for recording most 50-plus scores in ICC events. Kohli also broke the record for winning most Player of the Match (POTM) awards in T20Is, with 14 awards.

233.title: Govt releases pic of PM Modi in Kargil to celebrate Diwali
233.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday arrived in Kargil to celebrate Diwali. The Prime Minister's Office released a picture of PM Modi in the region and tweeted, "Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has landed in Kargil, where he will celebrate Diwali with our brave soldiers." PM Modi has been celebrating Diwali with Indian Army soldiers since 2014.

234.title: 11-yr-old activist's phone snatched while shooting live video; Noida Police responds
234.article_body: Environmental activist Licypriya Kangujam's phone was snatched in Greater Noida's Sector 16B on Sunday while she was going live on Facebook, the 11-year-old tweeted. Responding to her tweet, DCP Central Noida said, "Police station in-charge Bisrakh has been directed to take necessary action...FIR has been registered at police station Bisrakh, necessary legal action is being taken in advance."

235.title: Begin your revolutionary 5G journey with Airtel 5G Plus: Airtel
235.article_body: Airtel announced that its 5G Plus services will be available in 8 cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai and more in a phased manner. The brand has been at the forefront of 5G innovation, offering 30 times higher speed with super-fast call connect, it said, adding that the Airtel 4G SIMs offers 5G services on all 5G smartphones.

236.title: Want to come back here again: Ram Charan on RRR's response in Japan
236.article_body: Actor Ram Charan, who has been in Japan promoting his film 'RRR', has said that he wants to come back to the country again. "I can see so many emotions in this room, which is making me emotional. This is so heartwarming...appreciative. I can never forget this moment," he added. 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli was also present in the auditorium.

237.title: Rohit Sharma shares pics from India-Pakistan match, says 'Great night at the G'
237.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to share pictures from India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match, which took place at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday. "Great night at the G," he captioned his post. Commenting on his post, a fan wrote, "Your and Virat's hug was the moment of the match."

238.title: Many think there's cold war between Rohit, Virat but it's not like that: Jaffer
238.article_body: Talking about the viral pic of India captain Rohit Sharma lifting Virat Kohli after their T20 World Cup match against Pakistan, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said, "It was a good moment." Jaffer added, "Many fans think there's some cold war going on between Rohit and Virat but it's nothing like that." Kohli scored 82*(53) to help India defeat Pakistan.

239.title: 'Ghabrana nahi hai' is not working: Saeed Ajmal after Pakistan's loss to India
239.article_body: Taking an apparent dig at Pakistan captain Babar Azam following their defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022, former Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal tweeted, "'Ghabrana nahi hai' is not working." The term 'Ghabrana nahi hai' has been known to have been used by Babar to encourage his players. Pakistan lost the match on the last ball.

240.title: Delhi's air quality moves towards 'very poor' category on Diwali morning
240.article_body: The air quality in Delhi on Diwali morning moved towards 'very poor' category amid a drop in temperature and wind speed. The Air Quality Index (AQI) stood at 298 at 6 am on Monday. Forecasting agency SAFAR earlier predicted that the air quality may plunge to 'severe' levels on the night of Diwali if people burst firecrackers like last year.

241.title: Ex-UK PM Boris Johnson pulls out of Prime Ministerial race
241.article_body: Ex-UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced his decision to pull out of the race to replace Liz Truss as the nation's Prime Minister. "There's a very good chance that I'd be successful in the election...But in the course of the last [few] days, I've sadly come to the conclusion that this would...not be the right thing to do," added Johnson.

242.title: PM Modi, President Murmu wish people on Diwali
242.article_body: PM Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu greeted people on the occasion of Diwali on Monday. "Diwali is associated with brightness and radiance. May this auspicious festival further the spirit of joy and well-being in our lives," PM Modi said. "On this great festival, I pray for happiness and prosperity in the lives of all Indians," President Murmu tweeted.

243.title: Rahul Dravid hugs Virat Kohli after his match-winning knock vs Pakistan, pic goes viral
243.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid hugged Virat Kohli after the latter scored 82*(53) to help India defeat Pakistan on the last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. A picture of the same has gone viral on social media. "Two legends in one frame," a fan commented on the picture. "Very emotional," wrote another.

244.title: Warning issued to 8 states as cyclonic storm 'Sitrang' approaches
244.article_body: As the deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal intensified into cyclonic storm 'Sitrang', the IMD has issued red and orange alerts for eight states. 'Red alert' has been issued for Tripura, Assam, Mizoram, Manipur and Nagaland while 'orange alert' has been issued for Arunachal Pradesh and West Bengal. The cyclone will reach West Bengal-Bangladesh coast on Tuesday.

245.title: Pune Police use mild force as people block traffic after India's win over Pak
245.article_body: Pune Police used mild lathicharge to control the unruly crowd that gathered to celebrate India's win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup. "Many of them started bursting firecrackers. The crowd then came onto the road and blocked the traffic. The firecrackers were being burst in a dangerous manner," police said. Police also extinguished a large garland firecracker with water.

246.title: Bengaluru to witness partial solar eclipse for 45 minutes tomorrow
246.article_body: Residents of Bengaluru will be able to witness a partial solar eclipse for around 45 minutes on October 25. Beginning at 5:15 pm on Tuesday, the eclipse will last till sunset at about 6:00 pm and will be at its maximum at around 5:49 pm. Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium officials have asked residents to avoid watching the eclipse with naked eyes.

247.title: Activists throw mashed potatoes at $110 mn Monet painting in Germany, release video
247.article_body: A video has shown climate activists throwing mashed potatoes at a Monet painting at a German art gallery, weeks after activists doused a Van Gogh artwork with tomato soup in the UK. Two activists from Letzte Generation (Last Generation) vandalised French painter Claude Monet's Haystacks, which sold for $110 million (around ₹907 crore) in 2019, to protest a climate catastrophe.

248.title: Verstappen beats Hamilton to win US Grand Prix, Red Bull takes constructors' title
248.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen won the United States Grand Prix on Sunday, while his Red Bull team secured the Formula One constructors' world championship a day after the death of their billionaire owner Dietrich Mateschitz. Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton finished second in the race, followed by Charles Leclerc (Ferrari), Sergio Perez (Red Bull Racing) and George Russell (Mercedes).

249.title: Unbelievable game, India vs Pakistan is always more than a game, it's an emotion: Yuvraj
249.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Yuvraj Singh called India's match against Pakistan at T20 World Cup 2022 an "unbelievable" one. He tweeted, "India vs Pakistan is always more than a game...it's an emotion!"  Meanwhile, Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne tweeted, "This game is unbelievable!!!" and Dale Steyn wrote, "This game is ridiculous!" India defeated Pakistan on last ball, scoring 16 runs in last over.

250.title: Formula One pays tribute to late Red Bull owner Dietrich Mateschitz at American Grand Prix
250.article_body: Formula One paid tribute to late Red Bull and Red Bull Racing owner Dietrich Mateschitz at American Grand Prix on Sunday. Drivers, teams and fans came together for a minute’s applause to celebrate life of Mateschitz, who died on Saturday. "He was a man who inspired so much...he's the reason...we're here,” Red Bull Racing Team Principal Christian Horner said.

251.title: A jaw-clenching match until the very end: Suresh Raina on India-Pakistan T20 WC match
251.article_body: Talking about India's four-wicket win over Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 opener in Melbourne, Suresh Raina tweeted, "It has been a jaw-clenching match until the very end, a complete turn of tables bringing victory to Team India." He added, "The energy and fighting spirit showcased by all the players was brilliant. Congratulations on your outstanding win boys!"

252.title: Richard Gould named new England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive
252.article_body: Richard Gould has been named the new chief executive of the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB). Gould will begin his new role in January. The son of the former Wales football manager Bobby Gould, he is currently working in football as chief executive at Bristol City Football Club. He has earlier served as chief executive at Somerset and Surrey.

253.title: Turning back time, the chase master Virat Kohli is back: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah
253.article_body: After Virat Kohli slammed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, BCCI Secretary Jay Shah tweeted, "Turning back time! The chase master Virat Kohli is back and what a match to showcase his skills." He added, "What a game we have witnessed today!" India won the match on the last ball.

254.title: Aman Sehrawat becomes first-ever Indian wrestler to win gold at U-23 World Championships
254.article_body: Aman Sehrawat created history by becoming the first-ever Indian wrestler to win a gold medal at U-23 World Wrestling Championships in Spain's Pontevedra. The 18-year-old defeated Ahmet Duman of Turkey 12-4 in the 57-kg category final. Aman was the lone Indian male freestyle wrestler to get a visa and compete in the tournament.

255.title: What an emotional game tonight: Yuzvendra Chahal on India's win against Pakistan
255.article_body: Reacting to India's last-ball victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, Yuzvendra Chahal tweeted, "What an emotional game tonight. The pride we play for." He added, "A stunner of a performance by Virat Kohli. We march on together." Chahal didn't feature in the playing XI against Pakistan. India will next face Netherlands on Thursday.

256.title: Ronaldinho wishes Pelé on his 82nd birthday, shares pic
256.article_body: Former Brazilian footballer Ronaldinho took to Twitter to wish Pelé on his 82nd birthday on Sunday. Sharing a picture, he wrote, "Today is the day of the greatest of all...the KING! Happy birthday Pelé...Thank you for so many joys that you gave to all of us!! Long live the king."

257.title: This is why I love this sport: Rashid Khan on India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match
257.article_body: Reacting to India winning their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Pakistan on the last ball, Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan tweeted, "This is why I love this sport." He added, "What an exciting game of cricket between two great teams. Top performance Virat Kohli bhai." India scored 16 runs in the last over to win the match.

258.title: When the kingdom falls, the king rises: Amit Mishra on Virat Kohli
258.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli smashing 82*(53) against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, veteran spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "When the kingdom falls, the king rises...Take a bow King Kohli." Kohli's knock helped India defeat Pakistan by four wickets. India chased down the 160-run target on the last ball. Kohli slammed six fours and four sixes in the match.

259.title: Babar Azam gives speech in dressing room after defeat against India, PCB shares video
259.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam gave a speech in the dressing room after defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022. Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) shared a video on Instagram. In the video, Babar can be heard telling players, "We should not fall." He also encouraged Muhammad Nawaz, who gave away 16 runs in the last over against India.

260.title: I think I am a showman: Hardik Pandya after win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup
260.article_body: Following India's victory against Pakistan, all-rounder Hardik Pandya said, "I think I'm a showman. I will not come everyday but when I come I’ll put on a show." He added, "That’s why I messaged my wife and a few closest people and said, 'I don’t know, I just had a gut feeling that tonight is gonna be a special night'."

261.title: We know what Shaheen delivers but he wasn’t really there: Waqar on match against India
261.article_body: Following Pakistan's defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, former Pakistan captain Waqar Younis said, "We know what Shaheen Afridi delivers but he wasn’t really there." He stated that Shaheen lacked match practice, adding that he should have played in New Zealand ahead of the T20 World Cup. Shaheen Afridi went wicketless in the match.

262.title: Sourav Ganguly pulls out of the race to become the CAB's next chief
262.article_body: Former BCCI President Sourav Ganguly on Sunday pulled out of the race to become the Cricket Association of Bengal's next chief. Ganguly said, "I would've been elected uncontested, but I don't think it's right. Others wouldn't have got the opportunity to work for this association. They will be working for these three years now and we will see after that."

263.title: That was incredibly special, my friend: De Villiers to Kohli on his 82*(53) vs Pakistan
263.article_body: Praising his former RCB teammate Virat Kohli for his 82*(53) against Pakistan in India's T20 World Cup 2022 opener, former South Africa captain AB de Villiers tweeted, "Virat, that was incredibly special my friend!" He added, "The best of the best." Kohli smashed six fours and four sixes in his innings. India beat Pakistan by four wickets.

264.title: India bags a well fought win, special mention to Kohli for a spectacular innings: PM
264.article_body: Reacting to India's victory against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 opener on Sunday, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "The India team bags a well fought victory!" He added, "Congratulations for an outstanding performance today. A special mention to Virat Kohli for a spectacular innings in which he demonstrated remarkable tenacity. Best wishes for the games ahead."

265.title: Telangana logs 69 fresh COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
265.article_body: Telangana recorded 69 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the state government informed on Sunday, taking the state's total case tally to 8,39,640. Hyderabad reported 43 cases, the highest among all districts in the state. No new deaths due to the infection were reported. Telangana's active case count now stands at 542.

266.title: Bagnaia wins Malaysian GP to extend MotoGP title lead by 23 points
266.article_body: Ducati rider Francesco Bagnaia won the Malaysian Grand Prix to consolidate his lead at the top of the MotoGP board with one race left in the season. Bagnaia has a 23-point lead over Yamaha's Fabio Quartararo, who finished the GP in third place. "I did the best start I ever did in my life. It was perfect," said Bagnaia.

267.title: Use technology, why flare things unnecessarily: Akram on no-ball call in India's last over
267.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said the umpires should have used technology and consulted third umpire to check the waist-high no-ball signalled against Pakistan in India's last over. "To naked eye, it did not seem like a no-ball but in slow-motion, it does seem like it dipped," he added. He stated, "You have technology. Use it. Why flare up things unnecessarily?"

268.title: ISRO acquires land for new rocket launch site in Tamil Nadu
268.article_body: ISRO has acquired land for a proposed new rocket launch site in Tamil Nadu where a launch pad would be set up. "The design for the launch pad is ready. Once the land comes into our control...we will commence construction," said ISRO chairman S Somanath. The land is at Kulasekarapatnam in Thoothukudi district, about 650 km from Sriharikota.

269.title: Red alert issued for Assam, Meghalaya after heavy rains predicted
269.article_body: The meteorological department has issued red alerts for Assam and Meghalaya predicting heavy rainfall for three days starting Monday. Due to a depression over the Bay of Bengal, all states in the region will witness, heavy, very heavy and extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places. IMD said the depression "is very likely" to intensify into a cyclonic storm.

270.title: Kim Jong-un congratulates Xi Jinping for re-election as head of CCP
270.article_body: North Korea's leader Kim Jong-un sent a congratulatory letter to Chinese President Xi Jinping upon the latter's re-election as the Chinese Communist Party's (CCP) General secretary, North Korean state media reported. In his message, Kim Jong-un asserted that he would work alongside Xi so that the two leaders can continue to "powerfully propel the socialist cause" in their respective countries.

271.title: Should this be probed: Ali Zafar on waist-high no-ball in India's last over vs Pak
271.article_body: After former Australia spinner Brad Hogg questioned as to why the waist-high no-ball against Pakistan in India's last over was not reviewed, actor-singer Ali Zafar tweeted, "Hmm...This should be probed? I don’t know. What do the experts and the rules say?" He added, "Because that ball was the #turningpoint and @babarazam258 could be seen protesting with the umpires right after."

272.title: We've performed under pressure in past: Stoinis after loss to NZ
272.article_body: After losing to New Zealand by 89 runs on Saturday, Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said that the team knows that they performed under pressure in the past. "There was a bit of hurt in the change room after that [loss]...It's the first game of the WC and if we look after the rest then everything should be fine," Stoinis said.

273.title: Red Bull won 2021 world championship exploiting grey areas: Alonso
273.article_body: Alpine F1's Fernando Alonso said Red Bull exploited "grey areas" to win the 2021 world championship. "This has always been part of F1...people who won the championships...exploiting that grey area," said Alonso. He said Red Bull won't lose the title over their cost cap breach as "nothing happened" when Ferrari won "two races in 2019" with a "not legal" car.

274.title: I spoke to Anushka, she was over the moon: Virat Kohli after India's win vs Pakistan
274.article_body: Following India's win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, Virat Kohli said, "I spoke to my wife Anushka, she was over the moon." He added, "She just told me one thing, 'People are so happy. They are calling me to express their happiness'." Kohli slammed an unbeaten 82 off 53 deliveries to help India beat Pakistan.

275.title: Twitter user attributes fake quote regarding India-Pak match to Nasser, he responds
275.article_body: A Twitter user attributed a fake quote regarding India-Pakistan match to former England captain Nasser Hussain. The user claimed Nasser said that "umpires made some weird decision in favour of India". Nasser responded, "Probably best if you can delete this please...it's fake news and a fake quote and definitely not what a great game of cricket like todays deserves!"

276.title: Well done to the king and the rockstar: Karthik on Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya
276.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik penned a note after India defeated Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday. "Well done to the king and the rockstar," he wrote for Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya. He added, "Some moments are etched in life, this was one of them for me. Just privileged...to have been a part of this game."

277.title: Why were India awarded 3 byes after Virat Kohli was bowled off free hit vs Pakistan?
277.article_body: India were awarded three byes when Virat Kohli and Dinesh Karthik ran three runs after Kohli was bowled off free hit in last over against Pakistan. It wasn't a dead ball because on a free hit, a batter can get out only in four ways, which doesn't include bowled. India were awarded the runs as ball was still in play.

278.title: West Bengal logs 75 COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
278.article_body: West Bengal recorded 75 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.36% in the last 24 hours, the state health department said on Sunday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the state. West Bengal's active case count now stands at 3,504, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

279.title: Plan was to form partnership, bat deep: Hardik after win over Pak
279.article_body: After stitching a partnership of 113 runs with Virat Kohli against Pakistan, all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that the plan was to form a partnership and bat deep. "We did not have the option of going for big shots as we were four down. We had the belief we could win...I would like to thank everyone who supported me," Hardik said.

280.title: Delhi cracker ban shows Kejriwal is 'anti-religion': Gujarat BJP
280.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil has called Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal "anti-religious" for his government's decision to ban firecrackers in the national capital. Paatil said Kejriwal and AAP were trying to come to power in Gujarat and asked the gathering he was addressing how they will "burst firecrackers". AAP has said the ban is based on a Supreme Court order.

281.title: Kidnapped 16-yr-old Dalit girl found dead after 4 days in MP
281.article_body: A 16-year-old Dalit girl, who was allegedly kidnapped from her village four days back, was found dead in a field in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district on Sunday. The exact cause of the girl's death is yet to be known, police said. The class 11 student was allegedly kidnapped when she was returning from school on October 19.

282.title: 30 injured after UP-bound bus carrying labourers overturns in MP
282.article_body: At least 30 passengers were injured after a private bus carrying migrant labourers to Uttar Pradesh for Diwali overturned on Sunday in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district, an official said. The bus was coming from Gujarat's Surat, the official added. This comes after 15 people died and 40 others were injured when an UP-bound bus met with an accident on Friday.

283.title: 'Doctor G' is based on true events: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana
283.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his film 'Doctor G' is based on true events. "All of us have seen it a lot of times, even in the news, how doctors are beaten up for no reason...they're just doing their jobs," he stated. "So that is also being shown in the film," the actor added. 'Doctor G' also featured Rakul Preet Singh.

284.title: Southampton hold PL league leaders Arsenal to 1-1 draw at home
284.article_body: Premier League leaders Arsenal were held to a 1-1 draw by Southampton at the Saint Mary's Stadium. Granit Xhaka scored an early goal for Arsenal as Stuart Armstrong netted a second-half equaliser for the home side. This moves Arsenal to 28 points from 11 games, two ahead of Manchester City, while Southampton are 15th with 12 points from 12 games.

285.title: No one doubts Max Verstappen won 2021 F1 world championship: Vettel
285.article_body: Aston Martin F1 driver Sebastian Vettel said "nobody doubts" that Red Bull's Max Verstappen was the 2021 world champion. Vettel said it would be "stupid" to deduct championship points from Verstappen as punishment for Red Bull breaching the cost cap. "The FIA should come out and make it, very clear, very quick or very soon," said Vettel.

286.title: Kashmir is a safe and peaceful place: Iranian diplomat
286.article_body: While speaking at a conference organised by the J&K People's Justice Front, Iranian Embassy's Cultural Counsellor Dr Muhammad Ali Rabbani on Sunday said that Kashmir is a safe and peaceful place. The conference was organised to highlight the common cultural and heritage relations between India and Iran. Rabbani also lauded India's religious harmony. He also urged Iranians to visit Kashmir.

287.title: 12 arrested for killing elephant calf in Chhattisgarh's Korba
287.article_body: Chhattisgarh forest authorities have arrested 12 persons and detained a minor boy for allegedly killing an elephant calf and burying the carcass in Korba. The accused spotted the calf on October 18 and allegedly poisoned it the next day. Later, a herd of 44 elephants to which the calf belonged went on a rampage and killed a man.

288.title: For you 'Saat khoon maaf': Javed Akhtar to Virat Kohli over his 82*(53) against Pakistan
288.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli for his 82*(53) that helped India defeat Pakistan by four wickets in T20 World Cup 2022. "Virat tum ko saat khoon maaf. Thank you so much. Jeetay raho," he wrote. Meanwhile, Jasprit Bumrah wrote, "A match for the ages! A match that’ll go down in the history books...Well done India."

289.title: Wouldn’t have preferred anyone else with me out there: Hardik on stand with Kohli vs Pak
289.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya penned a note on Instagram after India defeated Pakistan by four wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Hardik, who shared a 113-run stand with Kohli, wrote, "At a loss for words...Wouldn’t have preferred anyone else with me out there...One of the best games of my life."

290.title: IMD releases predicted path of cyclone 'Sitrang' in the Bay of Bengal
290.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has shared a picture showing the observed and forecast track of cyclonic storm 'Sitrang'. The deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal had intensified into a cyclone at 5.30 pm on Sunday, the IMD said. The cyclone will cross the Bangladesh coast between Tinkona Island and Sandwip around October 25 (Tuesday), it added.

291.title: 5 people, including 4 teenage girls, drown in river in Bihar
291.article_body: Four teenage girls and a 40-year-old man drowned in the Punpun River in Hamidnagar village in Bihar's Aurangabad district on Sunday. The incident took place when the four girls aged between 13 and 15 years went to wash their clothes, an official said. Professional divers have been deployed to fish out the bodies, he added.

292.title: Iran's atomic energy agency says info leaked online following hack
292.article_body: Iran's atomic energy agency said that an e-mail server belonging to one of its subsidiaries had been hacked from abroad and information published online, state media reported on Sunday. On Saturday, Iranian hacking group Black Reward said that it had released hacked information relating to Iranian nuclear activities, saying it was done to express solidarity with the ongoing anti-hijab protests.

293.title: Had 'God syndrome' after 'Vicky Donor', felt like I'd arrived: Ayushmann
293.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said that he developed "God syndrome" after his debut film. "I felt like I had arrived. I think it happens when you get so much...success unexpectedly and you get the 'God syndrome'. However, I have seen several ups and downs in my life," he stated. Ayushmann made his debut with the 2012 film 'Vicky Donor'.

294.title: Punjab Speaker to give ₹1 lakh to panchayats not burning stubble
294.article_body: Punjab Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan on Sunday announced that he will give ₹1 lakh to every panchayat if farmers in that village abstain from burning stubble. This amount will be given from his discretionary quota, according to an official statement. "As people [are] getting aware about the harmful effects of stubble burning, they are abandoning this trend," Sandhwan said.

295.title: Man Utd must end relationship with Cristiano Ronaldo: Gary Neville
295.article_body: Former Manchester United captain Gary Neville said the club should "end" its relationship with forward Cristiano Ronaldo. "End it (the contract) this week or create a truce to get to the World Cup and then end it...It has to end," said Neville. He added that the club is "better without" Cristiano and manager "Erik ten Hag knows that".

296.title: 20,000 yaba tablets being smuggled to Bangladesh seized in Assam
296.article_body: A suspected drug peddler was arrested and as many as 20,000 yaba tablets were recovered from him in Assam's Karimganj district on Sunday. The seizure was made from a car while the drugs was being smuggled to Bangladesh. The action was taken by the BSF, vigilant troops of Mizoram and Cachar Frontier, police said.

297.title: Deep depression over Bay of Bengal intensifies into cyclonic storm ‘Sitrang’
297.article_body: The deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal intensified into cyclonic storm 'Sitrang' on Sunday evening. It will make landfall between Tinkona Island and Sandwip close to Bangladesh's Barisal in the early hours of Tuesday. The cyclone is likely to bring heavy to very heavy rain in coastal districts of South 24 Parganas and North 24 Parganas on Monday.

298.title: Hasbulla jokingly punches Ranveer Singh at UFC 280, actor shares video
298.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who attended UFC 280 in Abu Dhabi, took to Instagram Stories and shared a video with Hasbulla. In the video, Hasbulla can be seen punching Ranveer jokingly. Along with the video, Ranveer wrote, "Hasbulla taking no prisoners." Ranveer also shared pictures with Steven Seagal and Steve Harvey, who also attended the event.

299.title: Credit to Hardik, Virat for their performances: Pak skipper Babar
299.article_body: Despite losing to India by four wickets, Pakistan skipper Babar Azam said that his team bowled really well. "All credit to Kohli and Pandya. It wasn't easy with the new ball. We had partnerships after 10 overs," Babar said. "We had a lot of positives [from the match especially,] the way Iftikhar played and the way Shan played," he added.

300.title: France defender Varane's injury less serious than feared: Reports
300.article_body: Manchester United's French defender Raphael Varane's injury is reportedly "less serious than feared" and he can "still have hope" of playing in the World Cup. Varane left the pitch in tears with a leg injury during United's 1-1 draw against Chelsea on Saturday. Reports say Varane is expected to be out injured for between three and four weeks.

301.title: Very happy with my bowling: Arshdeep after taking 3 for 32
301.article_body: Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh said he is very happy with his bowling after the 23-year-old cricketer took three scalps against Pakistan in Melbourne on Sunday. "I didn't work too much on myself, just trying to keep things simple...We were talking..that we will take wickets in the starting and will restrict Pakistan...All credit goes to our batters," Arshdeep said.

302.title: Story for future generations: Ayushmann on watching final overs of IND vs PAK in flight
302.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana on Sunday recounted his experience of watching the final overs of today's match where India beat Pakistan, on a Mumbai-Chandigarh flight. Khurrana said, "This story is for my future generations." He said, "I've never witnessed a collective uproar of applause inside an aircraft...Thank you team India and Virat (Kohli) for bringing in Diwali a day early."

303.title: My best knock ever in T20Is, I'm lost for words: Virat Kohli on his 82*(53) against Pak
303.article_body: Virat Kohli, who smashed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match, said it's his best knock ever in T20I cricket. "I have no words, no idea how that happened. I am really lost for words," he added. He stated that his previous best knock was 82*(51) against Australia in T20 World Cup 2016.

304.title: 90,293 spectators watched India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match at MCG
304.article_body: As many as 90,293 spectators watched India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the ICC said. Reacting to the ICC's post on Twitter, a fan tweeted, "90,293 lucky people witnessed Greatest of All Time cricket match." India defeated Pakistan by four wickets by completing the chase on the last ball of the match.

305.title: Have lost my voice screaming: Sushmita Sen after India's win over Pak
305.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan by four wickets in the T20 World Cup 2022, actress Sushmita Sen took to Twitter and congratulated the team. "WHAT A GAME...Salute Virat Kohli, have lost my voice screaming!" Abhishek Bachchan also took to Twitter and wrote, "King Kohli!!! That's the tweet." Kohli scored 53-ball 82 in the match against Pakistan.

306.title: Kohli, Hardik break record of highest partnership for India against Pakistan in T20Is
306.article_body: Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya on Sunday broke the record for registering the highest partnership for India in a T20I against Pakistan. Kohli and Hardik registered a 113-run fifth-wicket stand to break the record. The previous record was held by MS Dhoni and Yuvraj Singh, who had recorded a 97-run fourth-wicket stand against Pakistan in a T20I in 2012.

307.title: Shoaib Akhtar shares pic to question umpires for giving no-ball in India's last over
307.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar shared a picture to question umpires for giving a waist-high no-ball in India’s last over against Pakistan in T20 World Cup, apparently suggesting it shouldn’t have been called a no-ball. “Umpire bhaiyo...food for thought aaj raat k liye (Umpires...food for thought for tonight),” Akhtar wrote. Kohli slammed a six off the no-ball bowled by Muhammad Nawaz.

308.title: India equal Aus' record for achieving highest target in last 3 overs of a T20 WC match
308.article_body: India on Sunday equalled Australia's record for achieving the highest target in the last three overs of a T20 World Cup match. India chased down 48 runs in the last three overs against Pakistan to equal the record. Australia had also chased 48 runs off last three overs against Pakistan in a T20 World Cup 2010 match.

309.title: So inspiring to see Virat Kohli cry and smile: Shah Rukh Khan on India's win vs Pakistan
309.article_body: Following India's four-wicket win over Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, actor Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "So good to see a great game of cricket. So wonderful to see India win." He added, "So brilliant to see Virat Kohli batting...and so inspiring to see him cry and smile...and the background score of Chak de India!! Happy Diwali starts right now!!!"

310.title: Irfan Pathan shares video of Sunil Gavaskar dancing during India's run chase vs Pakistan
310.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Instagram to share a video of Sunil Gavaskar dancing during India's run chase against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022. He wrote, "What scenes here at the MCG. Even the great Sunny ji couldn’t stop dancing...Virat you are the real king." "Look at Sunny bhai's enthusiasm," an Instagram user commented.

311.title: To divert public attention: Cong MP on action against Rajiv Gandhi Foundation
311.article_body: After the central government cancelled the FCRA licences of the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation (RGF) and Rajiv Gandhi Charitable Trust (RGCT), Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said the move is aimed at "defaming the Congress". "They (Centre) recycle old charges against the RGF and RGCT. This is to...divert public attention from issues of day-to-day concern faced by them," Ramesh added.

312.title: 'Rishi Sunak isn't even British', says racist caller on UK radio station; host responds
312.article_body: A racist caller joined a UK radio station and said, "Rishi Sunak isn't going to win the next general election...He's not even British." The show's host Sangita Myska immediately corrected the man, and said, "Rishi Sunak was born in the UK...I think you are fundamentally a racist." Notably, Indian-origin Sunak has formally declared he's running for the UK PM's post.

313.title: The MCG pitch for Ind-Pak game had something in it: Rohit Sharma
313.article_body: After winning the game by four wickets against Pakistan at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday, Indian skipper Rohit Sharma said that the pitch had something in it. "There was a nice carry. Some swing and seam. Good to see from the bowling perspective...We knew we had to bat out of our skin to chase this," Rohit said.

314.title: Sena's Priyanka Chaturvedi criticises minister who slapped woman
314.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi criticised Karnataka Minister V Somanna for allegedly slapping a woman during a public event. "BJP Minister. Karnataka. Likely explanation: Not a slap on the face but blessings on the cheek," she added. Chaturvedi also accused the government and the National Commission for Women of being silent on the issue.

315.title: Deadline to submit bids for Future Retail extended to November 3
315.article_body: As per the modified invitation of expression of interest (EoI) for Future Retail, which is undergoing the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process, the final date to submit bids has been extended to November 3. The final list of prospective buyers will be published on November 20, and the deadline for the submission of the resolution plan is December 15.

316.title: RPF officials save woman who fell from moving train while deboarding; video surfaces
316.article_body: A video showing a woman slipping while deboarding a train at Muzaffarpur station in Bihar has surfaced on social media. The video, shared by Railway Protection Force (RPF), shows RPF officials pulling her just as she was about to fall in gap between platform and train and be crushed under its wheels. She had reportedly boarded the train to defecate.

317.title: Kohli's best innings for India: Rohit on Virat's 82*(53) vs Pak
317.article_body: After Indian batter Virat Kohli scored 82*(53) against Pakistan on Sunday, skipper Rohit Sharma said that this was the best innings that Kohli has played for his country. "Taking the game deep was very critical...We were in no position to [get that target]. The way we won is more pleasing to us. Hats off to Virat" Rohit said.

318.title: Russian, British defence ministers discuss the situation in Ukraine
318.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu on Sunday discussed the situation in Ukraine with his British counterpart, Ben Wallace, over a telephone call, Russian media reported, citing the defence ministry. During the call, Shoigu reportedly conveyed Moscow's apprehension regarding Kyiv's plan to use a "dirty bomb" in Ukraine. Russia has provided no evidence regarding the claim about Kyiv's intention.

319.title: UK's destiny lies in Europe, Brexit sold as a 'mirage': EU official
319.article_body: EU's industry chief Thierry Breton on Sunday said Britain's destiny lies in Europe and that Brexit was sold to the country as "a sort of mirage". Breton said this while speaking about the current political turmoil in the UK. "We have a country which is completely destabilised, and a political party as well," Breton added, referring to the Conservative Party.

320.title: Virat Kohli, you are special: Shahid Kapoor after India's win over Pak
320.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram and shared a picture of Virat Kohli after the latter scored a match-winning 53-ball 82 runs against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. "Virat, you are special. Thank you for today. If you believe and if you persevere, you become the vessel through which the world witnesses magic," Shahid captioned the post.

321.title: Cometh the hour, cometh the stage, cometh the man: Ravi Shastri on Virat Kohli
321.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last delivery in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Ravi Shastri shared a picture of Rohit Sharma lifting Virat Kohli. Praising Kohli for his 82*(53), Shastri wrote, "Cometh the hour, cometh the stage, cometh the man @virat.kohli." Kohli came to bat in the second over after KL Rahul's dismissal.

322.title: Ayodhya sets Guinness World Record as nearly 16 lakh diyas lit, pics released
322.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Sunday shared pictures as 15.76 lakh lamps were lit in Ayodhya on the eve of Diwali, in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "World record re-established...Ayodhya entered the Guinness Book of World Records," said a UP Tourism Twitter page. PM Modi launched the Deepotsav celebrations on the banks of the river Sarayu on Sunday.

323.title: Sehwag shares PM Modi's 'Rona band kijiye' meme for Pakistan after their loss to India
323.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to social media to share PM Narendra Modi's 'Aap log rona band kijiye (Please stop crying)' meme for Pakistan after their defeat to India in T20 World Cup 2022. "Request to neighbours," he captioned. "I hope they don't break TVs today," a Team India fan commented on his post on Instagram.

324.title: If an eagle doesn't fly for 2 days, pigeons can't claim the sky: RP Singh on Virat Kohli
324.article_body: Praising Virat Kohli for smashing 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup 2022, former India pacer RP Singh tweeted, "If an eagle doesn't fly for 2 days, pigeons can't claim the sky." Meanwhile, Merv Hughes tweeted, "How good Virat!!!! Outstanding!!" "Virat Kohli well and truly back to his best," wrote Ian Bishop.

325.title: There was no slap: Woman allegedly 'hit' by Karnataka minister
325.article_body: The woman who was allegedly slapped by Karnataka minister and BJP MLA V Somanna refuted the allegations saying "there was no slap". "I went there to ask for help and requested him to give land. At the same time, I fell on his feet and somebody said [Somanna] slapped me," she said. "It's just an allegation against [Somanna]," she added.

326.title: 'Sabka sath, sabka vikas' inspired by Lord Ram's values: PM Modi
326.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the 'Deepotsav' celebrations in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya on Sunday said the concept of 'sabka saath, sabka vikas' was drawn from the values inculcated by Lord Ram. PM Modi addressed a gathering at the Ram Katha park ahead of Diwali. He also offered prayers to Ram Lalla at the temporary Ram temple.

327.title: Salman Rushdie has lost sight in one eye, one hand incapacitated: Agent
327.article_body: Salman Rushdie has lost vision in one eye and one of his hands is incapacitated, his agent said in an update two months after the India-born author was attacked and stabbed multiple times in New York. "He had three serious wounds in his neck. One hand is incapacitated because the nerves in his arm were cut," Rushdie's agent added.

328.title: 7 including 2 minors arrested over software engineer's gang-rape in J'khand
328.article_body: Seven people, including two minors, have been arrested in connection with the gang-rape of a 26-year-old software engineer in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum, according to police. The arrests were made after interrogating some local residents who frequented the area in Chaibasa, where the incident took place, police added. The woman's wallet and mobile phones were recovered from the accused.

329.title: Scheduled outages introduced in Kyiv after strikes on energy infra
329.article_body: Scheduled "stabilisation" power cuts were introduced in the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv on Sunday "to avoid accidents" following repeated Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure, Kyiv's power operator DTEK said during the day. The outages should last "no more than four hours" but may be longer "due to the scale of damage to the power supply system", DTEK added.

330.title: Been a beautiful year: Radhika Madan on completing 'Soorarai...' remake
330.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan took to Instagram Stories and shared a picture from the sets of her untitled film with actor Akshay Kumar. "It's a wrap for project number five of this year! It's been a beautiful beautiful year guys. Can't wait to see you at the movies," Radhika wrote. The film is a remake of the Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru'.

331.title: Pakistan will not agree for neutral venue for 2023 Asia Cup: Engineer
331.article_body: After BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said that India won't travel to Pakistan for the 2023 Asia Cup, ex-cricketer Farokh Engineer said that Pakistan won't agree to hold the tournament at a neutral venue. "They (Pakistan) need the resources and foreign teams to play in Pakistan. They have been deprived of cricket for a long time," Engineer said.

332.title: One of the greatest victories under pressure: Rahul on Ind-Pak match
332.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi congratulated the Indian team for its victory over Pakistan by four wickets in Melbourne on Sunday. "What a thriller of a match against Pakistan...One of the greatest victories under pressure. Well done team India...Best of luck for the matches ahead [in the T20 World Cup]," Rahul tweeted. Notably, batter Virat Kohli scored 82*(53).

333.title: Russia's 2 largest banks open vostro account for overseas Rupee trade
333.article_body: Russia's two largest banks, Sberbank and VTB Bank, have opened special vostro accounts following permission from the Reserve Bank of India to facilitate overseas trade in Rupee. The banks have reportedly opened these accounts in their branches in Delhi. The vostro account enables settlement of payments in rupee for trade between India and Russia, enabling cross-border trade in Rupee.

334.title: I'm sorry if anyone felt hurt: K'taka minister as video shows him slapping woman
334.article_body: After a video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman surfaced online, the minister said, "Though I did not misbehave at all but if anyone felt hurt then I apologise and express my regret." "I was trying to make her stand aside, indicating her with my hand. There was no other intention...I have high regards for women," Somanna added.

335.title: Cricket can be cruel and unfair: Ramiz Raja after India beat Pakistan in T20 World Cup
335.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja tweeted, "A classic!" He added, "You win some, you lose some and as we all know this game can be cruel and unfair. #TeamPakistan couldn't have given more with bat and ball. Very proud of the effort!"

336.title: Hardik breaks down remembering late father after India's last-ball win vs Pak
336.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya broke down remembering his late father after India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday. "He left his city and came to another city for cricket career of his sons. It's a huge thing," Hardik said. Hardik's father passed away in January 2021 due to heart attack.

337.title: PM Narendra Modi launches Deepotsav celebrations in UP's Ayodhya
337.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday launched the Deepotsav celebrations in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya, on the eve of the festival of Diwali. "Lord Ram doesn't leave anyone behind, doesn't turn away from anyone," PM Modi said. Over 15 lakh earthen lamps will be lit as part of Deepotsav celebrations by over 22,000 volunteers, said Ayodhya Divisional Commissioner Navdeep Rinwa.

338.title: It hurt: Vijay Varma on losing 'Kai Po Che' to Sushant Singh Rajput
338.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma revealed he had auditioned for a role in the 2013 film 'Kai Po Che', which was eventually played by late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. "It hurt at that time but I've seen...actors who come up to me and say 'I wanted to do that role, you were doing'," he added. Vijay also auditioned for 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag'.

339.title: Raj Police share 'Diwali Dhamaka' poster to warn those spreading fake news
339.article_body: Rajasthan Police on Sunday shared a 'Diwali Dhamaka' to warn against sharing messages that may disturb communal harmony. "Free! Free! Free! Rajasthan Police's special offer on Diwali. One mistake can make you take a trip to the jail, and that too for free," it added. Police also urged people to light firecrackers in open spaces and not inside their homes.

340.title: Apple to run app-related ads on App Store from Oct 25
340.article_body: Apple announced that it will run app-related advertisements on App Store in the Today tab from October 25 in all countries except China. On its website, Apple wrote, "With a Today tab ad, your app can appear prominently on the front page of the App Store." The Today tab had no paid placement options previously.

341.title: Apple starts paying out $100 million fund to App Store developers: Report
341.article_body: Apple has reportedly started paying out $100 million cash reserve created as part of a class-action settlement to its App Store developers. The company agreed to create the Apple Smart Developer Assistance Fund under a lawsuit brought by the US developers concerned with App Store policies. Eligible developers stood to get paid from $250 to $30,000 under the settlement.

342.title: Man cheated of ₹3.5 crore over currency notes in Navi Mumbai
342.article_body: The CBD Belapur police in Navi Mumbai has filed a case against over half a dozen people for cheating a Gujarat businessman of ₹3.5 crore. The fraudsters promised the businessman to help him convert old currency notes into new ones that he could give as Diwali bonuses to employees. They later staged an 'arrest' to run away with the money.

343.title: Tree House Education gets clean chit in misstatements of financial case
343.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has given a clean chit to Tree House Education  & Accessories Ltd, its promoters and other officials in an alleged financial misstatements case after a financial audit. In a letter, SEBI said that since a forensic audit showed no instances of any financial misgivings, no action will be taken.

344.title: 29 wagons of goods train derail in UP, 20 other trains affected
344.article_body: As many as 29 wagons of a goods train derailed at Ramwa station near Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur on Sunday morning, disrupting the movement of 20 other trains on the route. Railway engineers said that work to clear the track is underway and traffic on the route is expected to return to normalcy by evening.

345.title: ICC shares pics of moments after India's last-ball win vs Pak, says 'Etched in history'
345.article_body: The ICC took to official Twitter account of T20 World Cup 2022 to share pictures of moments after Ravichandran Ashwin scored a single on the last ball to help India beat Pakistan in their Super 12 match. "Etched in history," the ICC captioned the post. India scored 16 runs off the last over to win the match by four wickets.

346.title: Soap and oil actors leave their shoots to film for ads: Subhash Ghai
346.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai, speaking about the current generation of actors, has said that the "soap and oil" actors leave their shoots to film for advertisements. "The actors of the 90s still understand the importance of the story...today's generation wants the money to come first, they're just bothered about their personal branding and fees," he added.

347.title: Google removes apps from Play Store for performing ad fraud: Report
347.article_body: Google has removed 16 apps from Play Store which were performing ad fraud as they were impersonating a real user by clicking on ads and redirecting to web pages in the background, a security firm alleged. These apps were also causing faster battery drain and high data usage on Android devices. They had 20 million downloads before they were removed.

348.title: Kerala Governor seeks resignations of VCs of 9 universities
348.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Sunday sought the resignations of vice-chancellors of nine universities in the state. He directed the VCs that the resignations should reach him by 11.30 am on Monday. The Governor upheld a recent Supreme Court order quashing the appointment of the VCs of APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University for being contrary to UGC regulations.

349.title: Rohit Sharma lifts Virat Kohli in joy after India beat Pakistan, pics go viral
349.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma lifted Virat Kohli in joy after India defeated Pakistan on last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. Pictures and videos showing the same went viral on social media. In one of the videos, Rohit can be seen running towards Kohli and lifting him up, while Hardik Pandya can be seen clapping.

350.title: Virat Kohli alone burst firecrackers for the entire country: Sunil Chhetri
350.article_body: Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli after the latter slammed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "Virat Kohli alone burst firecrackers for the entire country...Happy Diwali, India," Chhetri wrote. India completed their 160-run chase against Pakistan on the last ball.

351.title: Kohli shares pics from India vs Pak T20 World Cup match, calls it a 'Special win'
