351.article_body: Virat Kohli took to Instagram to share pictures from India versus Pakistan T20 World Cup match held in Melbourne on Sunday. "Special win. Thank you to all our fans for turning up in numbers," Kohli captioned the pictures. Kohli, who smashed 82*(53) against Pakistan, said, "I rank this innings as my best."

352.title: Which states & UTs have imposed curbs on firecrackers during Diwali this year?
352.article_body: Delhi and Haryana have banned the sale, purchase and use of fireworks on Diwali, with Haryana making an exception for green firecrackers. The Punjab government has allowed the bursting of crackers during the 8 pm-10 pm window, while in Tamil Nadu crackers can be burst during two one-hour windows. Bihar also banned crackers in Patna and two other cities.

353.title: Netflix to open gaming studio, seeks to explore cloud gaming
353.article_body: Netflix has decided to open its fifth gaming studio in Southern California as it looks to seriously explore a cloud gaming offering, company's Vice President, gaming, Mike Verdu said. Verdu added that Netflix is looking at the cloud gaming service as a "value add" and not as a "console replacement". At its studios, Netflix has 14 games in full development.

354.title: Undoubtedly the best innings of your life: Sachin to Kohli on his 82*(53) vs Pakistan
354.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli for his match-winning 82*(53) against Pakistan in India's first T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "It was undoubtedly the best innings of your life. It was a treat to watch you play, the six off back foot in 19th over against Rauf over long-on was spectacular!" Sachin wrote.

355.title: Fighter jet crashes into residential building in Russia's Irkutsk
355.article_body: A Russian fighter jet crashed into a residential building in Russia's Irkutsk city on Sunday, killing both pilots, Irkutsk region's governor said. The aircraft has been identified as a Sukhoi Su-30, which officials say was on a test flight. No one on the ground was hurt, as per authorities. Another Sukhoi jet crashed in Russia's Yeysk city earlier this week.

356.title: 35-yr-old man pushed from running train by Govt Reserve Police in UP; dies
356.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Arun Bhuiyan, died after he was allegedly pushed from a moving train by Government Reserve Police (GRP) officials near Unchdih railway station in Uttar Pradesh. According to a complaint filed by Bhuiyan's friend, an argument broke out between GRP officials and Bhuiyan. The argument then led to two GRP officials throwing Bhuiyan out of the train.

357.title: Mumbai-based NGO finds banned toxic chemicals in city's firecrackers
357.article_body: A Mumbai-based NGO conducted independent tests on firecrackers in the city and claimed some of them contain banned chemicals such as arsenic, sulphur, barium and chlorine. The NGO has written to the police and Maharashtra government on the same. They also conducted a noise test on the crackers and found that they all fell within the permissible 120-decibel limit.

358.title: You freaking beauty, you've brought joy on the eve of Diwali: Anushka on Virat
358.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma, the wife of cricketer Virat Kohli, took to Instagram to celebrate India's win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup as Kohli smashed 82*(53). "You freaking beauty!! You've brought sooooo much joy in people's lives tonight and that too on the eve of Diwali," she said. "I've just watched the best match of my life," she added.

359.title: 3 dead, 8 injured in attack on hotel in Somalia's Kismayo
359.article_body: A blast hit a hotel in Somalia's port city of Kismayo when an explosives-laden car rammed into the hotel's gate on Sunday, following which gunfire erupted at the scene, according to police officials. At least three people were killed in the attack and eight others were injured, as per authorities. Militant group al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.

360.title: Shivling scene in 'Baahubali' created no controversy as it was respectful: Amish
360.article_body: Author Amish Tripathi opened up about the 'Shivling' scene from SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning' and said that the scene created no controversy. "It's one of the most iconic scenes in Indian cinema. It's a very respectful scene, viewers can see the intention," Amish added. In the scene, Prabhas breaks the base of 'Shivling' and carries it to the waterfall.

361.title: Banks financing Musk's Twitter deal to not sell debt to investors: Report
361.article_body: Banks providing $13 billion in financing for billionaire Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter have abandoned plans to sell the debt to investors because of uncertainty around Twitter's fortunes and losses, Reuters reported. Banks are reportedly planning to keep the debt on their balance sheets until there's more investor interest. Debt package for the Twitter deal is comprised of junk-rated loans.

362.title: Nasdaq pauses IPOs of small Chinese firms amid stock rallies probe
362.article_body: The IPOs of at least four small Chinese companies have been put on hold by Nasdaq as it investigates the short-lived stock rallies after the debut of these firms. Nasdaq has informed lawyers and bankers that some IPOs will not proceed "until they determined what has been the aberrational trading activity in certain Chinese issuers earlier this year".

363.title: Haryana govt declares 50% VAT rebate for industrial units using natural gas
363.article_body: The Haryana government announced that it has decided to offer a 50% rebate in value-added tax to industrial units that will replace diesel generators with natural gas. The scheme will be applicable to entire industry including micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs). The finance committee also approved a yearly subsidy of ₹164.66 crore to EV manufacturing companies under various heads.

364.title: My heart couldn't take that anymore: Rishad Premji as India beats Pak in T20 WC
364.article_body: Taking to Twitter to congratulate Virat Kohli and the Indian Cricket Team for their win against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said, "My heart couldn't take that anymore." India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last ball in Melbourne. Rishad Premji further added, "Truly amazing - team India and Virat Kohli!!"

365.title: Gandhi family, its NGOs not above law: BJP on FCRA licence cancellation
365.article_body: BJP welcomed the cancellation of the FCRA licences of Rajiv Gandhi Foundation and Rajiv Gandhi Charitable Trust (RCGT) associated with the Gandhi family for allegedly violating the foreign funding law. The party said that the Gandhi family and organisations linked to it cannot be above the law. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra claimed the action "exposed" Gandhi family's corruption.

366.title: Dr Reddy's, Cipla & Aurobindo Pharma's US-based units recall products
366.article_body: US-based unit of Dr Reddy's Laboratories is recalling 2,838 ampules of vitamin K deficiency treatment drug due to "failed stability specifications", according to the US Food and Drug Administration. Cipla is recalling 9,041 cartons of a COPD medicine due to "lack of assurance of sterility". Aurobindo Pharma's US unit is recalling 80,080 vials of injection used to control heavy bleeding.

367.title: FPIs sell Indian equities worth nearly ₹6,000 crore in October
367.article_body: The data with the depositories showed that foreign investors have sold Indian equities worth ₹5,992 crore in October (till 21) as the dollar strengthened against the rupee. The total outflow by Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) has reached ₹1.75 lakh crore so far in 2022. However, according to data, FPIs had slowed down their selling substantially during the last few days.

368.title: ICC shares graphic after Kohli helps India beat Pakistan, tweets 'The King is back'
368.article_body: After Virat Kohli's 82*(53) helped India defeat Pakistan on last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match, the official Twitter handle of ICC shared a graphic showing Kohli sitting on a throne. "The King is back...Take a bow, Virat Kohli," the ICC wrote. Kohli's innings included six fours and four sixes.

369.title: Virat Kohli punches ground, tears up after India defeat Pakistan on last ball, video viral
369.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Virat Kohli tearing up after Team India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match in Melbourne on Sunday. The video also shows Kohli punching the ground after his 82*(53) helped India chase down the 160-run target. Kohli smashed six fours and four sixes in the match.

370.title: 'Adipurush' director releases new poster of Prabhas on actor's b'day
370.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut has released a new poster of actor Prabhas as Lord Ram on the occasion of the actor's 43rd birthday. Taking to Instagram, Raut shared the poster and wrote, "Maryada Purushottam Prabhu Shree Ram." Prabhas also shared the poster on his Instagram account. Recently, the film's teaser was trolled on Twitter over its VFX.

371.title: Deepawali begins: Amit Shah after India defeats Pakistan in T20 World Cup
371.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah took to Twitter on Sunday to congratulate the Indian cricket team for defeating Pakistan in the T20 World Cup match in Melbourne. "A perfect way to start the T20 World Cup...Deepawali begins," Shah tweeted. "What a cracking innings by Virat Kohli. Congratulations to the entire team," he added.

372.title: PM Modi offers prayers to Ram Lalla at Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya
372.article_body: PM Narendra Modi offered prayers to Ram Lalla at Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya ahead of Diwali on Sunday. Modi arrived in Ayodhya to attend Deepotsav celebrations, during which around 18 lakh earthen lamps will be lit to celebrate Diwali. PM Modi was welcomed by Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel and CM Yogi Adityanath.

373.title: Mobile phone suddenly explodes during repair in UP; video goes viral
373.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media which showed a mobile phone suddenly exploding while it was being repaired at a mobile shop in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur. Reportedly, the mobile was brought in for repair due to a problem with its charging. The shopkeeper and two others had a narrow escape in the incident.

374.title: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to visit India in Nov: Reports
374.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will reportedly visit India on November 14 while on his way to the G20 summit in Bali, Indonesia. The Crown Prince is visiting India on the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and it will be a day-long visit, reports citing sources said. Last week, Saudi Energy Minister Abdulaziz bin Salman visited India.

375.title: China will open its door wider to the world: Xi Jinping
375.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Sunday said his country will open its door wider to the rest of the world. "China cannot develop in isolation from the world. The world's development also needs China," Xi stated. This came as Xi secured a third term as the Chinese Communist Party's head, making him the most influential party leader since Mao Zedong.

376.title: India defeat Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup as Virat Kohli smashes 82*(53)
376.article_body: India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne on Sunday. India chased down the 160-run target as Virat Kohli smashed an unbeaten 82 off 53 deliveries. India have now won nine out of 12 T20I matches against Pakistan.

377.title: No women in China's Politburo for the first time in 25 years
377.article_body: The Chinese Communist Party's decision-making body, Politburo, will have no women members for the first time in 25 years. Sun Chunlan, the only woman sitting on the previous Politburo, has retired. China will be ruled by an all-male Politburo for the next five years as President Xi Jinping secures a historic third term in power.

378.title: Don't insult common man by calling facilities 'revdi': Kejriwal to PM
378.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked PM Narendra Modi to not insult the common man by calling facilities of free education and treatment as "revdi". Tweeting a report of PM Modi slamming the political culture of "revdi" or freebies, Kejriwal said, "People are quite worried due to inflation. Why should they not get free education, treatment, medicines and electricity?"

379.title: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan celebrates Diwali with COVID orphans at his residence
379.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan celebrated Diwali eve at his residence with COVID orphans who lost their parents during the pandemic. He extended Diwali greetings to the children and was also seen dancing with them. According to the reports, 315 children were present in the programme. He planted saplings with the children before the beginning of the celebrations.

380.title: Mob thrashes suspected cattle smuggler, sets his vehicle on fire
380.article_body: A mob thrashed a man over the suspicion of smuggling cattle in West Bengal's Howrah. The mob set his vehicle, allegedly used for the act, on fire. "Locals witnessed a few cattle smugglers taking an ox in their wagon. One accused was caught and handed over to the police, while the rest are absconding," a local resident said.

381.title: Ludhiana civic body carries out trials for anti-smog guns ahead of Diwali
381.article_body: In view of rising pollution levels, the municipal corporation has begun conducting trials for anti-smog guns across different parts of Ludhiana. Attached with tractors, generator and a water tanker, the guns were taken through the city’s main roads and markets as part of the trials. Authorities said the anti-smog guns will be stationed at certain points after Diwali.

382.title: Virat Kohli overtakes Rohit Sharma to become highest run-scorer in T20I cricket
382.article_body: Former India captain Virat Kohli on Sunday overtook India captain Rohit Sharma to become the highest run-getter in T20I cricket. After scoring his first 30 runs in India's T20 World Cup 2022 opener against Pakistan, Kohli overtook Rohit's tally of 3,741 runs. Kohli is playing his 102nd innings in T20I cricket.

383.title: Will have low-key Diwali celebrations among family members: Randhir
383.article_body: Actor Randhir Kapoor shared that the Kapoor family will have "low-key" Diwali celebrations. "We are meeting each other...When we meet, that itself becomes a party as we're a very big family," he shared. Randhir added that the family will have a get-together at Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan's house on Sunday evening.

384.title: BJP and RSS were trying to rewrite India's history: Cong MLA Abdur Rashid
384.article_body: Assam Congress MLA Abdur Rashid Mandal criticised the BJP and the RSS and alleged that both organisations were trying to rewrite the history of India. "[They] are now trying to create a fake history of the country. Everyone knows the history of India. When the BJP-RSS are rewriting India's history, it is only a history [of hate]," said Mandal.

385.title: Won’t let BJP turn K’taka into lab of hatred, misgovernance: Rahul
385.article_body: Congress won't allow Karnataka to be turned into a laboratory for BJP’s experiments with hatred and misgovernance, party leader Rahul Gandhi said. "Through untiring efforts of our state leaders, drawing on rich cultures of Karnataka and support of crores of Kannadigas, that day will soon come when we will unleash Karnataka’s true potential through the path of love...harmony," he added.

386.title: India record their lowest 10-over score against Pakistan in T20I cricket history
386.article_body: India today recorded their lowest 10-over score against Pakistan in a T20I. India were restricted to 45/4 in first 10 overs by Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. India lost wickets of Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Suryakumar Yadav and Axar Patel within the first seven overs. India's previous lowest 10-over score in a T20I against Pakistan was 53/3.

387.title: K'taka withdraws order to collect ₹100 donation from govt school students
387.article_body: The Karnataka government has withdrawn an order to collect ₹100 as monthly donations from students to develop government primary and high schools. The order, which was issued earlier this month, has been criticised by parents and opposition parties. "After looting 40% commission from government coffers, they now want to loot from the parents too," Congress leader Siddaramaiah had said.

388.title: Hardik, Rohit get angry as spider cam denies India a potential wicket vs Pak, video viral
388.article_body: A video went viral showing India captain Rohit Sharma and all-rounder Hardik Pandya getting angry after spider cam denied India a potential wicket of Pakistan's Shan Masood in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Masood had lofted a Ravichandran Ashwin delivery which went on to hit spider cam wire before landing in no-man's land. Masood scored 52*(42) in the innings.

389.title: Happiest Minds fires 'few' employees for moonlighting, calls it 'unacceptable'
389.article_body: Bengaluru-based IT services firm Happiest Minds Technologies fired a "few" employees who were found to be moonlighting, company executive Joseph Anantharaju told PTI. "[Moonlighting] is something we will not accept...because when you sign a contract or employment offer, you are agreeing to work only for that company," he said. Moonlighting practice is "not too pervasive" at the company, he added.

390.title: Telegram to auction usernames for 700 million users via blockchain
390.article_body: Telegram has announced that it'll auction off usernames for 700 million users on its messaging app via its blockchain-based platform. Telegram said it would use The Open Network blockchain to host the auction. "This would create a new platform where username holders could transfer them to interested parties in protected deals," said Telegram Founder Pavel Durov.

391.title: Some of us from different parties will join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maha: Pawar
391.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said he will participate in Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra wherever possible when it enters Maharashtra. "Bharat Jodo Yatra is a Congress party programme but through this, an attempt is being made to bring harmony in society. So, some of us from different parties will join the march wherever possible when it's in Maharashtra," Pawar said.

392.title: Sonu Sood to make writing debut with action-thriller film 'Fateh'
392.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood will be making his writing debut with his upcoming action-thriller film 'Fateh'. "Personally, I have worked a lot on script and screenplay...But I'll take the credit for this for the first time," Sood said. He shared that the film revolves around the issue of digital scams for which the team has been consulting with ethical hackers.

393.title: The team deserves applause for their efforts: MP Medical Education Minister
393.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Medical Education Minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang, while talking about Hindi MBBS books said "the entire...team deserves applause for their relentless efforts for over six months to make it happen". "Those raising questions on introduction of Hindi in MBBS courses should know that the system which is going to be...implemented for the first time...is a revolutionary step," he added.

394.title: 21 kg heroin seized from truck on Jammu-Srinagar highway, driver detained
394.article_body: A truck driver was detained on Sunday after 18 packets of heroin, weighing around 21.5 kg, were seized from his vehicle on Jammu-Srinagar national highway in J&K’s Udhampur. The seized contraband is worth crores of rupees in the international market, an official said. "During checking...at Zero Point on the highway at Chenani, truck coming from Kashmir…was intercepted," the official stated.

395.title: RSS leader pays visit to Delhi's Nizamuddin Dargah ahead of Diwali
395.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar visited Hazrat Nizamuddin Dargah in New Delhi and lit earthen lamps inside the premises of the shrine. "The festival of Diwali is celebrated in the world, including India...This festival erases all the religious differences...Everyone should follow their own religion and caste. Do not criticise and insult others' religions," said Kumar.

396.title: Pune man tries stealing power for Diwali stall, dies
396.article_body: While attempting to steal electricity for a Diwali stall set up by a woman in Aundh, a Pune man died of electrocution. The deceased, identified as Pravin Ashok Mane, tried to steal electricity from a Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) feeder pillar. The woman and the deceased were booked under IPC and the Electricity Act.

397.title: Delhi records 'poor' air quality for 8th straight day ahead of Diwali
397.article_body: The air quality in Delhi was recorded in the 'poor' category for the eighth consecutive day on Sunday as smog engulfed Delhi and neighbouring areas. The overall AQI in Delhi was recorded at 243 at 10 am on Sunday. It was around 265 on Saturday evening. The air quality is likely to deteriorate in the coming days.

398.title: Gurugram records 2nd highest number of dengue cases in last 7 yrs
398.article_body: After four new dengue cases were reported in Gurugram on Saturday, the district took its total tally of cases to 337 for this year, while 327 cases were reported last year. This is the second-highest number of dengue cases recorded in the district in the last seven years. The worst-hit areas have been Wazirabad, Farrukhnagar, Pataudi and Ghangola, among others.

399.title: 2 more people test positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala
399.article_body: Uganda's Health Ministry on Sunday said two more people, who were admitted in an isolation unit of the country's main hospital in the capital city of Kampala, had tested positive for Ebola. On Saturday, the ministry reported three confirmed cases from the same hospital. The five confirmed cases are the first known transmission of the virus in Kampala.

400.title: Robbie Coltrane's death certificate reveals multiple causes including sepsis & diabetes
400.article_body: Actor Robbie Coltrane, who passed away recently, died from a series of conditions including multiple organ failure, sepsis, lower respiratory tract infection and heart block. According to his death certificate, the actor also suffered from diabetes and obesity. Coltrane, who was famous for his role as Rubeus Hagrid in 'Harry Potter' films, had been unwell for some time.

401.title: Interpol launches world's first global police Metaverse
401.article_body: International crime control organisation Interpol has launched the world's first global police Metaverse for law enforcement officials to increase cooperation. Users of this Metaverse can interact with each other and even take training courses on forensic investigation and other policing capabilities. Interpol will also create an expert group to represent officials' views on security in Metaverse.

402.title: Shameless man should be sacked: Jairam after K’taka minister slaps woman
402.article_body: After a video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman during a public event was widely shared online, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh tweeted, "This shameless man should be sacked immediately!" Furthermore, he said, "What a difference from the way Rahul Gandhi began the Karnataka leg of Bharat Jodo Yatra from the very same Gundlupet on 30th September!"
